subject: final call: 2 new positions at csiro  robotics australia in-reply-to: <d246230c-0fb7-4e60-89bb-26ff8d27d19b@csiro.au> references: <d246230c-0fb7-4e60-89bb-26ff8d27d19b@csiro.au>
content: deadline: 15th june we are very pleased to announce two new positions (a postdoctoral fellowship, a software engineer) at the csiro data61 robotics and autonomous systems group, located in brisbane, australia. we are looking for a postdoc fellow and a machine learning engineer with experience in machine learning and computer vision to join our robotics group. we are currently building new technologies that exploit bayesian deep learning models for multiple modalities of high dimensional data (lidar, thermal, hyperspectral) in the context of real-time robotic applications. who we are: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__research.csiro.au_robotics_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rvtx4koityrk3xgucrlsu2klvvg681fzsqa2se83w9e&s=hidnjlgm0mki93ptmfrn_wziqjdl-q0u0glkcajk8k4&e= before applying, we encourage you to read the full position descriptions for these roles. these documents can be viewed at: *postdoctoral fellowship ? probabilistic multispectral deep learning* https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__jobs.csiro.au_job_brisbane-252c-2dqld-2dpostdoctoral-2dfellowship-2dprobabilistic-2dmultispectral-2ddeep-2dlearning_475151000_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rvtx4koityrk3xgucrlsu2klvvg681fzsqa2se83w9e&s=_19o9qifurkgxjfcdhkhtwzegrvdrmjiyhod_lfkw9y&e= *software engineer - applied 3d machine learning* https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__jobs.csiro.au_job_brisbane-252c-2dqld-2dsoftware-2dengineer-2dapplied-2d3d-2dmachine-2dlearning_475152200_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rvtx4koityrk3xgucrlsu2klvvg681fzsqa2se83w9e&s=salmet6bbia4ndr-h70exz1tkrhqc9584xhuzblqfza&e= *how to apply: * to apply, please provide a cv as well as a cover letter addressing the selection criteria in brief, and upload these as one document to the links above. please *do not* email your application directly.  applications received via this method may not be considered by the selection panel. please feel free to forward this information to anyone whom you think is interested. regards, a/prof. peyman moghadam csiro data61 robotics and autonomous systems group

subject: post-doc position in control and  robotics at acfr, university of sydney
content: a post-doctoral research associate/fellow position is now open at the university of sydney. we are seeking applicants with a strong background and publication record in nonlinear control theory, control of robotic systems, predictive control, stability verification, and/or learning control to contribute to a project funded by the australian research council and led by a/prof ian manchester. this is a 2 year full time fixed term role with base salary: $90k-102k p.a, depending on experience, plus superannuation. for full details and application go to https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__sydney.nga.net.au&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0ga_h1cjwmqdn-3sjuphf8cb5gqqpla8o_8zrb9uhy8&s=yifxjyc4q4s2-ifd-tmbeqml0qrcaug90xrkpkcl8h4&e= and do a "job search" for "job reference" 1124/0618f closing date for applications is 22nd of july.

subject: postdoc-assistant (m/f) (tenure track)  in mobile robotics -- control of networked systems group (prof. stephan  weiss) @ aau
content: alpen-adria-universit?t klagenfurt announces the following open position in compliance with ?107 para. 1 universities act 2002: =============================================================== postdoc-assistant (m/f) (tenure track) =============================================================== at the faculty of technical sciences, department of smart system-technologies, control of networked systems group (univ.-prof. dr. stephan weiss). this is a full-time position (initial employment limited to 6 years) with the option of negotiating a qualification agreement (promotion to assistant professor). upon fulfilling the qualification agreement, the position progresses from assistant to tenured associate professor. minimum gross salary for this position is ?51,955.40 per annum (?27 uni-kv b1 lit b), ?61,441.80 after promotion to assistant professor (?27 uni-kv a2) and ?66,619.00 after promotion to associate professor. preferred starting date is september 1st, 2018. ** duties and responsibilities ** - independent research and further development of the candidate's scientific qualification to the level required for associate professorship, - publications and active participation in international conferences, - preparation of grant applications and management of research projects, - graduate and undergraduate teaching, examination activities, and supervision of students, - active support in shaping our young research group - participation in administration, in university committees, and in public relations activities  in the control of networked systems group, we seek to push the current limits in state estimation, cooperative visual perception, and multi-modal sensor fusion for autonomous and mobile networked systems. the group publishes in international top journals and conference proceedings. successful applicants will be encouraged and supported to publish their work in such journals and proceedings and will have the opportunity to cooperate with our world-renowned international partners from science and industry. we currently cooperate with partners mainly in the usa, australia, asia, and in europe. we specifically encourage and support close and open collaboration with our peers both internationally and at the university. our teaching areas encompass control, systems theory, control of autonomous systems and vision-based state estimation. at doctoral student level, our group leads a recently established doctoral school in networked autonomous aerial vehicles encompassing three other research groups and two other institutes at the university. the topic of the doctoral school is a main research area of the entire university (cf. www.aau.at/en/research/research-profile/main-research-areas).  our young research group provides a highly dynamic, familiar, and friendly attitude and thus a collaborative and inspiring work environment with highly modern infrastructure, which is continuously updated and upgraded. successful applicants will have the unique opportunity to actively be part of shaping this new research group while enjoying the benefit of a well-established and supportive institute and university around the group. for more information visit sst.aau.at/cns and uav.aau.at. ** required qualifications ** - phd in the area of information and communications engineering, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, or computer science, graded with excellent academic success at a domestic or foreign higher education institution. - proven knowledge and extensive experience in at least one of the following areas: probabilistic state estimation, vision-based navigation, multi-modal sensor fusion, autonomous (aerial) vehicle guidance and navigation. - excellent track record in scientific publications in one or more of the above areas. - proven programming skills in matlab, c/c ++, or ros. - fluency in spoken and written english. ** additional qualifications ** - relevant international or practical experience. - experience in teaching and student supervision. - experience in research project acquisition and leadership. - fluency in spoken and written german. - social and communication skills, ability to work independently. candidates must meet the required qualifications by august 31st, 2018 at the latest. german language skills are not a formal prerequisite, but acquirement is expected within two years. the nature of the position requires the candidate to relocate to klagenfurt. the university aims to increase the proportion of women in scientific positions, especially in leadership and therefore encourages qualified women to apply for the position. in case of equivalent qualification, women are accepted preferentially. persons with disabilities or chronic diseases who fulfill the requirements are particularly encouraged to apply. the application must be submitted electronically in pdf format using the reference code 292/18 via the link www.aau.at/obf. the application must be written in english, including a letter of motivation, the curriculum vitae (with information about the degrees including date/place/grade, the experience acquired, the thesis title, the list of publications if any and any other relevant information), copy of the degree certificates and transcripts of the courses and any certificate that can prove the fulfillment of the required qualifications (e.g. the submission of the final thesis/dissertation if required by the study program) and including details of three contact persons who can supply corresponding references. the deadline for the applications is july 18th, 2018. general information for applicants is available on www.aau.at/jobs/information. information about research on networked autonomous aerial systems at alpen-adria-universit?t klagenfurt is available on uav.aau.at. further information about the related doctoral school is provided on www.aau.at/en/research/research-profile/karl-popper-kolleg. additional information on the control of networked systems group is available on sst.aau.at/cns or by contacting prof. dr. stephan weiss, +43 463 2700 3571, stephan.weiss(at)aau.at. short-listed candidates will be invited to an interview. travel and accommodation costs incurred during the application process will not be refunded. translations into other languages shall serve informational purposes only. the english version alone shall be legally binding.  ===== the deadline for the applications is july 18th, 2018. =====

subject: jobs available in marine robotics at  the university of sydney's australian centre for field robotics
content: hi all, we have two positions available that are associated with the marine robotics program at the university of sydney?s australian centre for field robotics (acfr). the first position will be based at the university of sydney and is a technical role supporting the autonomous underwater vehicle (auv) facility associated with our nationally funded integrated marine observing system (imos) program.  we are looking for someone with strong software development skills interested in supporting an extensive program of marine fieldwork.  our team works at sites around australia deploying and collecting data using auvs to support the study of changing benthic habitats, from coral reefs in the north through kelp forests and sponge gardens in the south.  interested applicants are referred to the following link for more details and application procedures.  the applications close july 8th, 2018. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__sydney.nga.net.au_cp_index.cfm-3fevent-3djobs.checkjobdetailsnewapplication-26returntoevent-3djobs.processjobsearch-26jobid-3d127cf2cb-2de648-2d44b2-2db244-2da8e2008c44bd-26curatc-3dext-26curbid-3d949319bc-2d8898-2d4f11-2dac4b-2d9db401358504-26jobslistkey-3d2a8e3426-2d8c30-2d4298-2d854e-2dbb751e0bad88-26persistvariables-3dcuratc-2ccurbid-2cjobslistkey-26lid-3d87225300008&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=xshq9fttjqhva7nv-h2kt1o1sf-ohnpdu956e0rjxdq&s=fxedut5z586mzmyvkrxzvzfpwso3332qhi2arobdkzi&e= the second role is a 2-year postdoctoral position developing machine learning techniques to support marine science studies.  it will be based at the sydney institute for marine science (sims) situated on the beautiful sydney harbour.  it will have strong links to the university of sydney?s acfr but will also engage with other researchers around australia.  the focus will be on developing innovative machine learning techniques to help manage the large volumes of seafloor imaging data being collected by the imos auv facility but will also engage with other data sources, such as satellite imagery, oceanographic measurements and acoustic data.  interested applicants are referred to the attached pdf for application details.  the applications close june 30th, 2018. should you have any questions about these positions, please do not hesitate to let me know.  please pass on to anyone who might be interested in joining us here in sydney. regards, stefan stefan b. williams head of school of aerospace, mechanical and mechatronic engineering university of sydney sydney, nsw, 2006 australia

subject: phd]phd studentship: co-operative  control of heterogeneous autonomous vehicles
content: two phd scholarships are available to work on co-operative control of heterogeneous autonomous vehicles including 4 hexa-copters and 2 - 3 large scale autonomous vehicles. the aim is to develop aerial surveillance based systems suitable for unmanned forest fire fighting systems. the research includes, threat prediction, terrain sensing and assessment, planning for ground vehicle routing and optimised resource utilisation.  the phd studies need to be carried out at the university of new south wales in sydney, australia and will be associated with the school of mechanical and manufacturing engineering and the school of electrical engineering and telecommunications. the scholarships include: (i) tuition fee waiver (ii). a$ 40000/annum stipend. (iii). a$10000/annum career development expenses (e.g. conference attendance, publications costs, external courses) for more information please visit: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.2025.unsw.edu.au_apply_scientia-2dphd-2dscholarships_coordinated-2dremote-2dcontrol-2dunmanned-2dground-2dvehicles-2dusing-2dautonomous&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=bmimjkrblvulq2ifyj1dzzcnefdljsgocwkqlzl3qzw&s=46fq2dig2me53gac3mqgfbzbr1ofyj14tlzbnnrid4q&e=.

subject: multiple tenure track faculty positions  in robotics at university of new south wales, sydney, australia
content: multiple tenure track faculty positions in robotics at university of new south wales, sydney, australia unsw engineering is recruiting outstanding and inspirational individuals to join our world-leading group of researchers and teachers to build on our success and take the faculty into the world?s top 20 engineering faculties. as australia?s leading engineering faculty, we create bold new solutions to globally relevant challenges to improve lives.  we combine the world?s best facilities and innovative research with an exciting and connected education experience to open doors for our graduates. links to (4) tenure track job postings in robotics and mechatronics are listed here: lecturer - professor in autonomous systems the school of mechanical and manufacturing engineering the school of mechanical and manufacturing engineering is one of the largest and most prestigious in australia, with 2500 student enrolments, 80 academic staff, 25 professional staff, and total annual budget of over $22 million including external research grants. our mission is to prepare students for careers of leadership and innovation, create new scientific advances, and translate research outcomes to positively impact national and global industry and society. we are seeking to attract high-calibre researchers and educators to expand our thriving research programs and contribute to our education excellence in aerospace, mechanical engineering, advanced manufacturing engineering, robotics and mechatronics. for further information about the school, please visit https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.engineering.unsw.edu.au_mechanical-2dengineering_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=g6nuavfi0j9_fn78ou9dmzi9tdmsu7i5lxm_eyxlryc&s=lxop4koqyon6a-beq2girbziv3dmapuqfpiuon_vlzy&e=.<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.engineering.unsw.edu.au_mechanical-2dengineering_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=g6nuavfi0j9_fn78ou9dmzi9tdmsu7i5lxm_eyxlryc&s=lxop4koqyon6a-beq2girbziv3dmapuqfpiuon_vlzy&e=> about the role we are seeking an exceptional lecturer, senior lecturer, associate professor or professor to deliver outstanding research and teaching in the area of autonomous systems with focus on integration of processes. the appointment would be:   *   at level b ($103k - $121k), at level c ($125k - $143k), at level d (149k - $164k) or at level e ($191k) (plus 17% superannuation and leave loading) per annum, commensurate with academic qualifications and experience,   *   full time,   *   to a convertible tenure track employment contract for an initial fixed term period of 5 years, with conversion to continuing appointment based on satisfactory performance and there being sufficient productive work available. the faculty reserves the right to offer an appointment on a continuing basis or to directly appoint to advertised positions. about you we are looking for an exceptional candidate to conduct high impact research, deliver outstanding teaching and student experience and build industry engagement in the field of advanced manufacturing of biomedical devices and scaffolds. as the successful candidate, you will have:   *   a phd in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering or an area of direct relevance;   *   a demonstrated record of excellence in research with international impact;   *   a commitment to delivering high quality and innovative teaching at undergraduate and graduate levels; and,   *   the ability to actively engage with industry and the community. unsw desires to be the exemplar australian university and employer of choice for people from diverse backgrounds.  unsw aspires to ensure equality in recruitment, development, retention and promotion of staff, paying particular attention to ensuring no-one is disadvantaged on the basis of their gender, cultural background, disability or indigenous origin. engineering strongly encourages female applicants and actively supports women to succeed through specific faculty and unsw initiatives and generous parental leave provisions and flexible work practices. applicants with industry experience are especially welcome. the preferred candidate will be required to undergo pre-employment checks prior to appointment.

subject: postdoc position in robotic vision  evaluation and benchmarking, australian centre for robotic vision, brisbane
content: we are looking for a creative and visionary postdoctoral researcher to  join our team to solve problems working at the intersection of robotics,  vision, learning and applications. you will be part of the robotic vision evaluation and benchmarking project team of the centre. in your new position, you will have a leading role in developing new  standardised benchmark tasks and evaluation metrics to foster  reproducible research in robotic vision. remuneration of $aud110,428 to $aud131,147 pa (level b) (inclusive of  $aud93,313 to $aud110,821pa salary,17.5% recreation leave loading and  17% superannuation) fixed-term, full-time for two(2) years selection criteria: 1. completion of a doctoral qualification in robotics, computer vision, machine learning or related discipline. 2. comprehensive experience with ros. 3. expertise in python and c++ programming and proficiency in linux. 4. demonstrated ability to write reports and journal papers on the research outcomes. 5. detailed knowledge of the state of the art of robotics, computer vision, and machine learning. position description: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__qut.nga.net.au_publicfiles_qut_jobs_964302b3-2d7292-2d4075-2d83b3-2da444072fd97f_researchfellow-5facrv-5ffinal.pdf&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vhtqfdaqtaq0mwcigmjsilrxmwv_zzbgqam12aq8z1g&s=ceeuxkib7ii7mraicydcoztazfobnxoh-1y9arlnhoe&e= content: the school of computer science and engineering, unsw. positions in: cyber security; medical image processing and medical informatics; robotics & autonomous systems; smart cities. the school of computer science and engineering (cse) is one of the largest and most prestigious computing schools in australia and highly ranked internationally. it offers undergraduate programs in software engineering, computer engineering, computer science and bioinformatics, as well as a number of combined degrees with other disciplines. it attracts excellent students who have an outstanding record in international competitions. at the postgraduate level there is a large phd research program and coursework programs at the master?s and graduate diploma level in computing and information technology and at graduate certificate level in computing. our research mission is to be at the forefront of research into new and exciting innovations with profound national and international impact.  for further information about the school, please visit https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.cse.unsw.edu.au_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=cs1smqzkggd1u2yyqmmn59wzmltdyiikoe9cbc9n7m0&s=3puycvzibzwjpveaivuxrvfbv0ustvl5kvwtmzlh-ys&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.cse.unsw.edu.au_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=cs1smqzkggd1u2yyqmmn59wzmltdyiikoe9cbc9n7m0&s=3puycvzibzwjpveaivuxrvfbv0ustvl5kvwtmzlh-ys&e=>. the following positions are currently available in cse: robotics & autonomous systems - subject: phd positions in biomedical devices and  soft robotics at the university of new south wales (unsw), sydney
content: graduate school of biomedical engineering (gsbme), faculty of engineering, university of new south wales (unsw), sydney, australia is looking for phd positions starting in semester 1 (february/2019) or semester 2 (june/2019) with fully support for both tuition fee and stipend. the research projects will mainly focus on the design, fabrication, modeling, and control of soft robotics (sensors and actuators) and flexible mechatronic systems for surgical robotics (gastrointestinal cancer treatments), wearable computing, haptic/tactile displays, capsule endoscopy, and other related biomedical devices.  prospective students with background in one of more of the following areas is desirable: mechanical engineering, mechatronics, soft robotics, smart materials, and control. good hands-on skills and experiences in mechanical design, fabrication, sensors, actuators, and soft materials are plus. successful candidates should be highly self-motivated to pursue independent and interdisciplinary research. please feel free to contact dr. thanh nho do via dothanhnho at gmail.com with cv including names and contacts of two academic referees, representative publications (if applicable), and transcript. please follow the below links for more information: - key-dates:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__research.unsw.edu.au_key-2ddates&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=o3qomyextpc0-yot4smg-7avhlla95oayzylvxks-zy&s=qrdtqlr8igrwahk0mbn8zefwluf6jotlquotxuyp8r4&e=   about unsw: unsw australia is a research-intensive university ranked in the world?s top 50 universities (qs rankings 2018). unsw ranks 45th in the 2018 qs world university rankings, 85th in the 2018 times higher education world university rankings, and ranked 36th in the world for academic reputation. unsw is a member of the prestigious group of eight - a coalition of australia's leading research intensive universities and is australia?s most comprehensive research-intensive university, one of only two in the world to be ranked in 50 subject areas in the shanghairanking's global ranking of academic subjects 2017. unsw has a 7,000-strong research community. unsw is recognised as the australian university with the strongest links to industry, and in 2017 we received $56.2 million in australia research council (arc) funding. unsw is the #1 institution attended by australian startup founders.  about sydney: it is a great place to live and one of the most beautiful, liveable and friendly cities in the world. sydney is considered as the world?s most ?reputable city? ? 2016 city rep trak, the reputation institute and is ranked #2 2016 world?s friendliest city survey, conde nast traveller; #12 for best cities in the world, conde nast traveller 2016 reader?s choice awards;  #8 for monocle?s 2016 quality of life survey; #11 for eiu?s 2016 liveability ranking; #10 for business insider 2016 ?quality of living index?. the main unsw campus is located in the eastern suburbs of sydney only 7km from the centre of the city, 2km from coogee beach and 5km from sydney?s international and domestic airports -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=o3qomyextpc0-yot4smg-7avhlla95oayzylvxks-zy&s=jtnuohkvi47iegtgaj2vmqph-eylcylmgl0yfegqgkw&e=

subject: phd position on robot grasping @ aau  klagenfurt, austria
content: the institute of smart system technologies, sensors and actuators group,  faculty of technical sciences at alpen-adria-universitaet klagenfurt is  seeking to make the following appointment: ====================================================================== phd position in robot grasping - tactile sensing and proximity perception ====================================================================== *** duties and responsibilities *** - collaboration with scientific and industrial partners of the institute - independent research with the aim to submit a dissertation and to  acquire a phd - assistance in public relations activities *** recruitment conditions *** - a university degree (master or diplom-ingenieur) in the field of  electrical engineering and information technology, mechanical  engineering, computer science or a related subject, graded with  excellent academic success and corresponding knowledge in the field. - proven programming skills in at least one of the languages matlab, c /  c ++, python, ros - fluent in english both spoken and written - social and communication skills, ability to work independently *** additional (optional) qualifications*** - experience in one of the following fields: -- multiphysical modeling and simulation of sensors and actuators -- design of (computer) experiments -- additive manufacturing -- machine learning -- wireless transducers - relevant (international) practical experience - scientific publications the minimum gross monthly salary for this assignment amounts to ?  2.794,60 (14 x p.a., temporary contract for 3 years, scheme b1, 100%  employment, 40 hours/week) and can increase in accordance with the  provisions of the collective agreement in the case of consideration of  previous occupational experience. the scheduled start of the employment  is as soon as possible. the alpen-adria-universitaet klagenfurt intends to increase the number  of women on its faculty, particularly high-level positions, and  therefore specifically invites applications by women. among equally  qualified applicants women will receive preferential consideration. people with disabilities or chronic diseases who are qualified are  explicitly invited to apply. in the "sensors and actuators" group, we seek to push the current bounds  in sensor design and optimization, autarkic wireless sensors, sensors in  robotics and near field sensing. the group publishes in international  top journals and conference proceedings. successful applicants will be  encouraged and supported to publish their work in such journals and  proceedings and will have the opportunity to cooperate with our world  renowned international partners from science and industry. our network  comprises partners in europe, north and south america, australia and  asia. we specifically encourage and support close and open collaboration  with our peers both internationally and at the university. our young  research group provides a highly dynamic and friendly attitude and thus  a collaborative and inspiring work environment with highly modern  infrastructure, which is continuously updated and upgraded. for further information please contact prof. hubert zangl,  hubert.zangl at aau.at or visit our website at www.aau.at/sat.

subject: post-doc in robotic vision for  manipulation at qut / australian centre for robotic vision
content: we?re looking for a creative and imaginative postdoctoral researcher to join our team to solve real-world problems working at the intersection of robotics, vision, learning and manipulation. we?re particularly looking for people passionate about: * integrating hardware and software to build impressive robotic manipulation systems that perceive, act, and interact with the environment * deploying state-of-the-art machine learning on robots in the real world * integrating different fields of research, such as grasping, learning, probabilistic robotics, planning, and control * addressing the mismatch between the performance of deep learned systems evaluated on datasets/simulations and the real world * working in a large, diverse team of researchers at the intersection of robotics, vision, learning and application the position will be based at qut in brisbane, australia?s leading robotics group. we are offering two year contracts with a salary range between aud93,313 and aud110,821 and can also offer some assistance with relocation expenses. these are positions without teaching obligations, but with opportunities to supervise undergraduate and graduate students. the australian centre for robotic vision supports a flexible working environment. subject to visa restrictions, the present position is available as either full?time or part?time. women are strongly encouraged to apply. application deadline is august 12! feel free to reach out if you have any questions. more details and the process for applying can be found at: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__qut.nga.net.au_cp_index.cfm-3fevent-3djobs.checkjobdetailsnewapplication-26returntoevent-3djobs.processjobsearch-26jobid-3dad5d2a47-2d56e0-2ddea1-2dda70-2da444bbb2140c-26curatc-3dext-26curbid-3d1877e01e-2d78dd-2d4ed2-2d9d7a-2d9db40135cff4-26jobslistkey-3d18b08f28-2df1e1-2d45df-2dba4e-2dabd0d4c4c75c-26persistvariables-3dcuratc-2ccurbid-2cjobslistkey-2cjobid-26lid-3d63535360058&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=d2rhobqku6xg7coao-1ngspj-ewweldqakuoqo6dvre&s=_t6u5fo2gaz8dfzpke6fusnxlfpyr4jppoepbxbz0jg&e= or search for the vacancy at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www2.qut.edu.au_jobs_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=d2rhobqku6xg7coao-1ngspj-ewweldqakuoqo6dvre&s=dfeqkfdnt1bw_n4axtzssibv7qlgcn6cluioknocvg8&e= //juxi -- juxi leitner | j.leitner at roboticvision.org | @juxi australian centre for robotic vision, queensland university of technology - brisbane, australia "we need dreamers 'cuz in our dreams we see not what is but what can be!" https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__juxi.net_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=d2rhobqku6xg7coao-1ngspj-ewweldqakuoqo6dvre&s=bc4-e_qmsf5ra9tiweibnvqxqbvffzydg4bmud2ligk&e=

subject: funded phd in rehab-robotics and  neuromechanics, univ. of wollongong, australia
content: a funded phd position is available in the fields of rehabilitation robotics and the neuromechanics of human movement at the school of mechanical, materials, mechatronic and biomedical engineering (mmmb), university of wollongong, australia. it is expected that the thesis will involve interdisciplinary themes related to human-machine interaction, mathematical modelling and simulation, robotics and soft actuators, and human movement science. candidates are required to have a strong background in mechanics and mechanical design as well as knowledge of human physiology related to movement. additional experience in experimental methods (e.g. motion capture technology, emg etc) and demonstrable effectiveness in disseminating scientific results (e.g. publications/talks in conferences) will be considered favourably. deadlines/timeline: 1) by 15th september 2018: email a detailed cv (max 4 pages), publication list (or other supporting material), and a 1-page motivation letter to manishs at uow.edu.au 2) by mid-october 2018: shortlisted candidates apply to uow's scholarship program 3) final decision will be available in december 2018 with the position expected to commence in february 2019. why choose the university of wollongong?   *   the school of mmmb at uow is one of the top 10 engineering schools in australia. as a phd student here, you will have access to academics experienced in a range of fields such as manufacturing, robotics, material science and biomedical engineering. matching this expertise are the extensive state-of-the-art technical facilities available to research students. more info here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__eis.uow.edu.au_mmm_research_index.html&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=swrd8li6qo7zcuzcd4ulyjlkuvhhkpqlzd74s9dziv8&s=qyzzdl2m9hi1sqkl2flwxlpuodp9ibhk5kpxmon18hy&e=.   *   this position is offered as part of a newly filled faculty position at the school of mmmb. the successful candidate will have available a significant amount of time and effort of the supervisor/co-supervisor towards thesis guidance and a successful completion.   *   situated close to sydney, wollongong offers a great mix of coastal and city life. if you like the idea of sun, sand, surf and science, all in one place, then you can't go wrong with wollongong! ---------------------------- manish sreenivasa lecturer school of mechanical, materials, mechatronic and biomedical engineering (mmmb) faculty of engineering and information sciences (eis) university of wollongong wollongong, nsw 2522, australia web: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__scholars.uow.edu.au_display_manish-5fsreenivasa&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=swrd8li6qo7zcuzcd4ulyjlkuvhhkpqlzd74s9dziv8&s=-jt76hcem-ghxgcndmqw1zjgvdqbe8jdbhbgbboxbks&e= ph: +61 2 4298 1332

subject: phd studentship: deep-learning assisted  underwater robotic navigation, james cook university, australia
content: the australian institute of marine science (aims) and james cook university (jcu) in townsville, australia are looking for an excellent candidate to undertake a phd under the aims at jcu phd scholarship programme, for a project relating to deep-learning assisted underwater robotic navigation. these competitive scholarships are open to domestic and international research applicants and provide the following: *stipend for 4 years, plus tuition fees if applicable *additional funding support for professional development in quantitative methods appropriate to the project *additional $5,000 per year as stipend top-up or project costs (as agreed between student and supervisors) the ideal candidate will have a strong academic background in computer science, mathematics, engineering or a closely-related numerical discipline. they will have strong mathematical skills and demonstrated proficiency with a programming language. knowledge of artificial intelligence and/or robotics techniques is highly desirable. project synopsis marine robotics faces many unique challenges due to the complex and dynamic operating environment. the highly chaotic and cluttered nature of reef sites, the lack of a global positioning system underwater, reduced visibility, and imperfections in the obtained sensor data all present difficulties when designing navigation and control algorithms for autonomous underwater vehicles(auvs). with the recent advancements in machine learning, in particular large artificial neural networks with many layers (deep learning) there is much potential to enhance the robot?s capabilities beyond those achievable with present methods. the key idea of this project is to replace individual, ?traditional? modules in robotics pipelines, with deep learning based modules in order to improve the platform?s performance and reliability. the successful applicant will conduct highly experimental research on artificial intelligence and machine learning, and contribute to the conservation of australia?s coral reefs. the candidate will have access to resources at aims, with opportunities to join trials and scientific surveys at sea using state-of-the-art robotic platforms. how to apply full details of the application process and requirements are available at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__staging-2daims.jcu.edu.au_phd-2dscholarships_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ml0u5u5pj60tlpjjtnbgadwmjsn4cav6iivv_xkg8bc&s=oiw7m1yshtemrna7l0cxzstldigzhwbehnfruoinptu&e= the closing date for applications is 30th september 2018. note that the prospective supervisors from both aims and jcu must be consulted in the development of your application and support both your candidature and scholarship applications, so initial enquiries should be made as soon as possible. pre-applications and informal enquiries can be made to dr daniel cagara (d.cagara at aims.gov.au) with a copy of your curriculum vitae and cover letter indicating your interest in the project and why you wish to undertake it. best regards, dr daniel cagara dr paul rigby

subject: phd positions in multi-robot systems
content: up to three fully-funded phd positions are available at centre for autonomous systems (cas) within the university of technology sydney (uts). the doctoral students will be part of a team and carry out research on an exciting new project. the doctoral candidate positions are full-time, available from november 2018. as a doctoral student at cas, the successful candidates will have access to an outstanding phd program with very competitive benefits, and opportunity to collaborate with / mentored by renowned researchers and academics. the phd topics are about the development of methodologies that enable multi-robot systems to clean and maintain complex steel structures such as commercial cargo ship-hulls and truss structure. the research topics include (but not limited to) complete coverage planning, coordination of multiple robots, sensing and perception, motion planning and control. requirements: - excellent written and spoken english skills, - be self-motivated and independent, - a strong interest in robotics, programming, and mathematics, - a master degree in robotics, computer science, mechanical/mechatronic engineering, electrical engineering, or related fields (or a bachelor degree in such fields with outstanding transcript), - programming with matlab, c++, or python. please send your cv, transcripts, and publications (if applicable) to dr mahdi hasson (mahdi.hassan at uts.edu.au<mailto:mahdi.hassan at uts.edu.au>) or professor dikai liu (dikai.liu at uts.edu.au<mailto:dikai.liu at uts.edu.au>) by october 15th 2018. please also illustrate how your research interests/experiences align with this project and robotics in general. the centre for autonomous systems (cas) (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.uts.edu.au_research-2dand-2dteaching_our-2dresearch_centre-2dautonomous-2dsystems&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ns5af_idqq1gdfdl3vohrymskycnt3ordq01k0fsfl0&s=fh0o3fbcu7bntbzb6wjlp5ohxt2k8byw8wwadm_gvmo&e=) at the university of technology sydney (uts), australia is an internationally acclaimed robotics research group with over 80 robotics researchers (including phd students). cas' vision is to be an internationally recognised leader, at a scale and quality to be globally significant, for robotics research, development and commercial application of "autonomous and human interactive robotics". since its establishment in 2003, cas has demonstrated leadership in driving research advancements in robotics and in delivering real-world solutions to key challenges facing government, industry and the wider community. examples include the research in simultaneous localization and mapping (slam), autonomous abrasive blasting robots and bio-inspired climbing robots both deployed in the sydney harbour bridge for inspection and maintenance. cas has developed a very strong engagement program with industry and governments. cas prides itself on a culture of "cooperation, collaboration and ownership". uts cricos provider code: 00099f disclaimer: this email message and any accompanying attachments may contain confidential information. if you are not the intended recipient, do not read, subject: robotics software engineer- dorabot r&d  center in brisbane, australia
content: dorabot, a market-leader in ai-powered robotic logistics solutions, announced today the establishment of their first overseas r&d center in brisbane, australia. the brisbane center, a big step forward for the company in establishing an international footprint, will be led by amazon robotics challenge champion adam tow, an alumnus of qut's world-renowned australian centre for robotic vision. adam joined dorabot and moved to shenzhen last year to work on some of the company's ongoing commercial projects. noticing a relative shortage of robotics companies with r&d teams based in australia, adam and dorabot's executives saw an excellent opportunity to recruit talent down under and help local businesses by establishing a local r&d center in brisbane.  "i'm excited to help bolster the robotics industry here in brisbane," says adam. "we'll be working on a number of major projects alongside the shenzhen team before branching out to help local companies solve some of their most pressing logistical challenges." highlighting their friendly work culture and talented international workforce, dorabot hopes to attract employee.  mirroring their shenzhen headquarters, dorabot's aussie team will work out of a brand-new 700 m? warehouse (pictured above) in the brisbane suburb of tingalpa, offering employees plenty of space to develop and test all kinds of robotic solutions, including loading, sorting, transportation, and induction systems for express delivery facilities. dorabot plans to export this office model to other locations in the future, including the united states and additional locations in mainland china. the company is actively recruiting robotics software engineers and an hr administrator to support the newly established brisbane team. for applicants seeking opportunities in mainland china, the company also welcomes applications for job openings at their shenzhen headquarters. to celebrate the occasion, dorabot will be holding a launch party at fishburners brisbane coworking space on november 9th. dorabot will also be visiting various aussie universities to meet with job-seeking students. if you'd like to apply for a position at dorabot in brisbane or shenzhen, email a cv and cover letter to dream at dorabot.com. all our job openings can be found here. from adam's alma mater, qut, as well as other top-tier engineering schools.  "our decision to open an r&d center in brisbane was largely motivated by our goal to recruit more top-notch technical talent," says spencer deng, dorabot's ceo. "australian universities have world-class robotics programs, and we're excited to offer job opportunities to australian students both at home and abroad." jd of robotics software engineer https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.dorabot.com_careers_career-2dtechnology_81.html&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=iuuifdyslssfroh94a_9q6y5ozry0qfb73pvkiamqwc&s=wig9t11wffqlscsta9n4-mkety6ywc-v9lgl9ph7b4s&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.dorabot.com_careers_career-2dtechnology_81.html&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=iuuifdyslssfroh94a_9q6y5ozry0qfb73pvkiamqwc&s=wig9t11wffqlscsta9n4-mkety6ywc-v9lgl9ph7b4s&e=>   detailed intro. of dorabot https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.dorabot.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=iuuifdyslssfroh94a_9q6y5ozry0qfb73pvkiamqwc&s=zzbdjl14sunapcw3qf09odevggwhbhfvou_2lxmzwug&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.dorabot.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=iuuifdyslssfroh94a_9q6y5ozry0qfb73pvkiamqwc&s=zzbdjl14sunapcw3qf09odevggwhbhfvou_2lxmzwug&e=>   -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=iuuifdyslssfroh94a_9q6y5ozry0qfb73pvkiamqwc&s=gn2bakyb21flperlv9q26j-e_dtqhwwgvwzdjjqb8qc&e=

subject: postdoctoral research fellow in slam at  uts:cas
content: postdoctoral fellow in simultaneous localization and mapping centre for autonomous systems faculty of engineering and information technology university of technology sydney the centre for autonomous systems (cas)  at university of technology sydney (uts) seeks to appoint one postdoctoral research fellow with expertise in robotics localization and mapping, slam, visual navigation, or related fields; and experience in developing intelligent robotic software for industry applications, to further strengthen and expand cas research. as a member of cas and faculty of engineering & it (feit), you will be accountable for achieving uts vision of becoming a leading international technology university. *         the postdoctoral research fellow will contribute to research within the centre for autonomous systems in the uts faculty of engineering & it: *         conduct excellent and high impact research in the fields of robotics localization and mapping, slam, visual navigation, or the related fields *         liaise with industry partners and reporting *         develop collaborative research internally with colleagues within uts, and externally with researchers in other universities *         co-supervise research students *         contribute as a team-player to the activities of the centre *         assist project chief investigators (cis) to manage research projects the uts centre for autonomous systems (cas) within the school of mechanical and mechatronic engineering (mme) is an internationally acclaimed robotics research group. cas' vision is to be an internationally recognised leader, at a scale and quality to be globally significant, for robotics research, development and commercial application of "autonomous and human interactive robotics". since its establishment in 2003, cas has demonstrated international leadership in driving research advancements in robotics and in delivering real-world solutions to key challenges facing government, industry and the wider community. examples include the fundamental research in simultaneous localization and mapping (slam), autonomous robots for bridge maintenance and the autonomous bio-inspired climbing robots, both deployed in the sydney harbour bridge. cas currently has over 75 robotics researchers with international reputation in slam, infrastructure robotics, assistive robotics and robot teams. cas has developed a very strong engagement program with industry and governments. cas prides itself on a culture of "cooperation, collaboration and ownership". remuneration salary range: a$100,923 to a$115,486 pa (academic level b) how to apply for more information and to apply please click on this link: irc119616 postdoctoral research *         permanent/continuing full-time appointments (equivalent to tenure-stream) the school of mechanical, materials, mechatronic and biomedical engineering, which is one of the top engineering schools in australia, is committed to research and teaching excellence through its world-class undergraduate and postgraduate programs in a range of exciting technological areas. the discipline of biomedical engineering has been established with a focus on applying engineering principles, problem solving skills and methodologies to the research and development of novel medical and diagnostic devices including prosthetics, orthotics, assistive and rehabilitation devices and artificial organs, tools, systems and technology that will deliver substantial healthcare benefit and improve the quality of life for individuals. research expertise based on any of the following sub-fields is highly preferred, in random order: ?  bionics and neuroengineering ?  brain-computer interfaces or brain-machine interfaces, ?  rehabilitation engineering ?  biosensing and instrumentation ?  tissue engineering ?  tissue/cell biomechanics/ mechanotransduction ?  artificial organs and implants ?  musculoskeletal modeling ?  physiological modelling ?  electroceuticals ?  prosthetics and orthotics ?  orthopaedic engineering (especially in orthopaedic biomechanics) this position will be expected to teach at all levels of the biomedical engineering curriculum including the team-taught introductory engineering subjects and specialised subjects in biomedical engineering depending on the expertise of a successful candidate.  depending on the level of experience, academic leadership and achievements, research and teaching track records of the applications, they will be appointed either as associate professor or professor, and lecturer or senior lecturer. this position will also establish a vigorous research program that complements and enhances the extensive interdisciplinary engineering network at the university of wollongong, particularly in the areas of bionics, biomedical technologies, rehabilitation devices, biomaterials, biofabrication, synthetic biosystems, smart materials and structures, robotics, innovative fabrication methodologies and technologies. we are seeking an individual who will potentially not only be the thought leader of their research field, but also bring new momentum and strength to the school of mmmb engineering, particularly to its discipline of biomedical engineering. the university is committed to workforce diversity and removing barriers to participation. the university is seeking to increase the representation of women in the academic workforce across science, technology, engineering, mathematics and medical (stemm) disciplines and encourages suitably qualified candidates to apply. you will be prompted to respond to the selection criteria as part of the online application process, based on the position description below. you will be able to save your application at any time and submit at a later date if required, you will only be able to do this before the closing date of the position. for further information about this position, please contact professor gursel alici on + 61 2 4221 4145 and gursel at uow.edu.au<mailto:gursel at uow.edu.au>.

subject: phd scholarships in soft robotics,  haptics,  and flexible endoscopic systems for gastrointestinal cancer treatment
content: dear all, graduate school of biomedical engineering (gsbme), faculty of engineering, university of new south wales (unsw), sydney, australia is looking for phd positions starting in semester 2 (june/2019) and/or semester 3 (june/2019) with fully scholarship support for both tuition fee and stipend.  the successful students will work on projects related to the design, fabrication, modeling, and control of soft robotics (novel soft sensors and actuators), flexible mechatronic systems for flexible surgical systems (gastrointestinal cancer treatments), wearable devices (for haptic/tactile displays), soft capsule endoscopy for obesity/cancer diagnosis, novel soft sensors and actuators, and other biomedical devices (treatment for respiratory disorder, rehabilitation?).  detailed research projects will be discussed during the interviews. these positions will be based in graduate school of biomedical engineering in collaboration with school of mechanical and manufacturing engineering, faculty of engineering, university of new south wales (unsw), sydney, australia.  prospective students with background in these following areas are desirable: mechanical design, mechatronics, soft robotics, smart materials, and control. good hands-on skills and experiences in medical device design, mechanical fabrication, sensors, actuators, and soft materials are plus. successful candidates should be highly self-motivated to pursue independent and interdisciplinary research. ----------------- application:  interested students are invited to send their applications to dr. thanh nho do via tn.at unsw.edu.au and include: 1) cover letter with your detailed research interest (1-2 pages would be fine) 2) your cv with detailed experiences (previous and current projects, publications) and includes two academic references 3) academic transcripts and cert of degrees 4) soft copy of your publications if any (e.g. journals, conferences, thesis?) and links to illustration photos/videos, developed prototypes, website... 5) proof of english proficiency (toefl, ielts...) that meets minimum requirement from unsw (see below link). ------------------ note: only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interviews. successful students will work under dr. do?s supervision. ------------------ scholarship information: - key-dates: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__research.unsw.edu.au_key-2ddates&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=9zqpf2gypk8--o75zvzlbj6hmpqfep8k0xrg2qmwhi4&s=9cexb0rqh80jkmbwjmz0ykvxzvo9eazlpvclzdadaze&e= subject: faculty positions at the university of  sydney / australian centre for field robotics
content: the university of sydney has an opening for a new continuing (tenure-track/tenured) faculty member in robotics and mechatronic engineering. the position is open at all levels, from lecturer to full professor. we are particularly interested in recruiting in the areas of surgical robotics, mechanism design, robotic planning, grasping and manipulation. however, strong applicants in all areas of robotics will be considered and are encouraged to apply. the university of sydney currently has 10 continuing faculty members in robotics, who lead the australian centre for field robotics (acfr), which has over 100 researchers, grad students, and technical staff and a long history of fundamental research and major industrial collaborations. the university's new centre for robotics and intelligent systems is led by acfr and also includes researchers from medicine, business, arts and social sciences, and other disciplines. for full information about the position, and to make an application, please follow this link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_sydneyhiring2018&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=oms_rxlumowyiksojiz-b7gcw472ydr5zqriqamzmny&s=2xmdisfqx4citk3ykox3d4y9-5zpvhck1q0xlcfblha&e= roboticists may also be interested in the open faculty positions in aerospace engineering (including flight dynamics, navigation and control, rapid prototyping and unmanned aerial vehicles) and mechanical engineering (including mechanical design, dynamics, and micro-machines), both via the same link. for more information about these positions, please contact myself ( ian.manchester at sydney.edu.au) or head of school stefan williams ( stefan.williams at sydney.edu.au)

subject: fwd: research engineer: centre for  autonomous systems (cas), sydney, australia in-reply-to: <cac=1nk5c8wmymcp3ubf1unmyk_x1o1e0zzp9sjoiepc-iz5exw@mail.gmail.com> references: <cac=1nk5c8wmymcp3ubf1unmyk_x1o1e0zzp9sjoiepc-iz5exw@mail.gmail.com>
content: centre for autonomous systems (cas), university of technology sydney (uts) is seeking research engineers to join the team in order to solve challenging problems in developing autonomous robots. main duties include:    - design and manage the development and manufacturing of mechatronic    systems, and specialised equipment for experimental work    - design mechanical components for manufacturing and/or testing    - development and implementation of basic software and/or control systems    - design and development of custom embedded electronic circuits    - management of field testing and trials, both in research and    commercial environments we look for individuals with:    - demonstrated skills and ability to develop robotic systems;    - demonstrated strong mechanical design skills;    - experience in mechanical prototyping and embedded system programming;    - a bachelor?s degree, or above in mechatronic engineering, mechanical    engineering, electrical engineering or a related discipline this appointment will be on a full-time, fixed term for 12 months. the role attracts a base salary of au$76-93k per annum (hew6-7), and 17% superannuation in addition to the base salary. employee benefits include flexible work practices, child care centres, generous parental leave and salary packaging opportunities. cas is located at the uts city campus, downtown sydney. for further details and to apply, please visit the link below: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__recruitment.uts.edu.au_oa-5fhtml_oa.jsp-3foafunc-3dirc-5fvis-5fvac-5fdisplay-26p-5fsvid-3d120314-26p-5fspid-3d3731710&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=oxjrpakgvwfebjxmfytonga4ae_sz5bbkqizhc0niv0&s=va3f3_5kqlziatzb27au5xzmhxujqnp7ywbew_-kbp4&e=

subject: seeking distinguished researchers for  leading research professorship in western australia
content: western australia is at the heart of a boom in robotics and automation, impacting on the $100 billion resources sector, as well as agriculture, security, defence, medicine and disability. academic expertise in robotics is increasingly in demand for collaborative research projects as well as in training the next generation of mechatronics, robotics and automation engineers. curtin university is seeking outstanding research leaders in robotics and automation to spearhead an application to the premier's science fellowship (a professorial appointment). the premier's science fellowship is one of australia's most prestigious research fellowships, with minimum funding of aud$2 million over four years for the premier's fellow, and $1 million over four years for the affiliated premier's early-mid-career fellow. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.jtsi.wa.gov.au_what-2dwe-2ddo_science-2dand-2dinnovation_science-2dfunding-2dprograms_premier-27s-2dscience-2dfellowship-2dprogram&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ymfvmq_3fouu39smjexikkp9bz8xuuqhduwlzdpycpa&s=bpljmkpsgaq7pfyjt1fwoiatuquhcbtmsfcnnbzqrlq&e= suitable candidates will be distinguished researchers with an outstanding track record of publications, and a proven capacity to successfully run major research projects in collaboration with other academics and with industry. applicants must be within the disciplines of automation; robotics; artificial intelligence and/or machine learning. of particular interest will be candidates with a capacity to engage in robotics projects in mining/resources, agriculture and/or the medical sciences. expressions of interest for either the premier's science fellowship or the premier's emc fellowship can be sent to associate professor jonathan paxman j.paxman at curtin.edu.au<mailto:j.paxman at curtin.edu.au> in the first instance. early enquiries would be welcomed.

subject: robotics software engineer at boeing  research & technology (melbourne, australia)
content: we are currently looking for a software engineer on a 12 month maximum-term contract within the boeing research & technology team to support robotics and automation activities. the successful applicant will develop, and integrate software to support next generation manufacturing automation in australia and worldwide. focusing on robotics, vision systems, sensors, and networks, the successful applicant will join a multidisciplinary team of mechatronics, software, and aerospace engineers, and engage in the full project lifecycle from prototype to implementation. the role * to develop innovative solutions to technical problems of controlled scope * to design reusable software components as part of an integrated system * to develop robust autonomous airframe manufacturing technologies, including control and communications * to implement algorithms from the robotics and computer vision domains * to support systems and technologies from the prototype stage through to production demonstration and implementation * to support the br&t-a automation team in working with customers, suppliers and technology development partners. about you * degree in computer science, mathematics, mechatronic, software, or systems engineering * experience commensurate with that typically gained over 1-5 years within a software or systems engineering environment * demonstrated competency in c++/c# and/or python/matlab * experience with hardware/software integration and linux would be highly regarded * skills in modern version control practices and continuous integration/testing would be highly regarded * experience with 3d graphics and/or computer vision would be highly regarded * experience with robotics would be highly regarded * ability to work under limited supervision in experimental and laboratory environments * ability to work in small and large teams * ability to effectively communicate technical ideas * to work according to the standards and procedures of baa and br&t-a, particularly eh&s. this position is classified within the engineer/scientist classification range. the level will be dependent upon qualifications and experience.  the successful candidate will be required to complete pre-employment checks and a 3-month probationary period. please use the link below to apply: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__boeing.recruitasp.com.au_jobtools_jncustomsearch.viewfullsingle-3fin-5forganid-3d17511-26in-5fjncounter-3d223495188&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dfyjdxgapmd67nsbqwrsmdmsfwq4rr4kezijbap4dss&s=kzv7aupfckqcagrjhogd6qptvq8tyzwilnarzzcircu&e= martin szarski associate technical fellow boeing research & technology

subject: 2 post-doc positions at the university  of sydney
content: two post-doctoral research associate/fellow positions are open at the university of sydney's new centre for robotics and intelligent systems (cris), incorporating the australian centre for field robotics (acfr). strong candidates in all areas of robotics are encouraged to apply, though we are particularly seeking candidates in the areas of robotic imaging, dynamic perception and scene understanding, manipulation and locomotion, and distributed control, optimization, and learning. the positions are for two years, with a salary range of $92k - $123k p/a (aud) depending on experience. further details and applications are at the following link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_crispostdoc19&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=xqbqcdan8pwwg7ungcr1dsft2euznsqmnt2gm7gyuqy&s=z0a01rg9nvarafq3x0toq4xkp9fhfeg-t-qd1vxiitw&e= applications close 13th of january 2019.

subject: closing soon: 3 post-doc positions at  the university of sydney
content: three post-doctoral research associate/fellow positions are open at the university of sydney's new centre for robotics and intelligent systems (cris), incorporating the australian centre for field robotics (acfr). the salary range is $92k - $123k p/a (aud) plus generous benefits. 2x positions for 2 years are open to applicants in all areas of robotics, though with particular focus on imaging, perception, manipulation and locomotion, and distributed systems: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_crispostdoc19&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=uhh8rxjf_rg2kxvrl1jxx-9rrk9-ipkhoixf7ej2shy&s=y66u5zo8kuk5fm4qnquxyb6q0sqgb7wvtpjqklzvqlm&e= applications close 13th of january 2019 (sydney time) 1x position for 3 years is open with a focus on robust learning of dynamical systems, a.k.a. nonlinear system identification and reinforcement learning with stability/behavioural guarantees: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_robustlearning&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=uhh8rxjf_rg2kxvrl1jxx-9rrk9-ipkhoixf7ej2shy&s=jsnlpa58st1jvjqw1y1cgyn05ho2le4jrg_e1kie30q&e= applications close 20th of january 2019 (sydney time)

subject: postdoctoral fellow job opportunity:  centre for autonomous systems, university of technology sydney (uts),  australia.
content: postdoctoral fellow in perception, localisation and planning of industrial/construction robotics centre for autonomous systems faculty of engineering and information technology, uts an opportunity for up to two (2) early career researchers to join the uts centre for autonomous systems (cas), an internationally acclaimed robotics research group, and to work together with robotics researchers at uts. cas has strong links with researchers and industry locally and abroad. the postdoctoral fellow(s) is expected to contribute to strengthen this relationship. the uts centre for autonomous systems<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.cas.uts.edu.au_&d=dwmgaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=aupavugokghwvyftvtousrhu4h40sdj6i426naep4j0&s=4u1lfwi87bt6dv7anfy11n-gbwzeg04airmwmmxgess&e=> (cas) within the school of mechanical and mechatronic engineering (mme) is an internationally acclaimed robotics research group. cas? vision is to be an internationally recognised leader, at a scale and quality to be globally significant, for robotics research, development and commercial application of autonomous robotics. since its establishment in 2003, cas has demonstrated international leadership in driving research advancements in robotics and in delivering real-world solutions to key challenges facing government, industry and the wider community. examples include the autonomous robots for bridge maintenance and the autonomous bio-inspired climbing robots, both deployed in the sydney harbour bridge. cas currently has over 75 robotics researchers (including phd students) with international reputation in slam, infrastructure robotics, assistive robotics and robot teams. cas has developed a very strong engagement program with industry and governments. cas prides itself on a culture of cooperation, collaboration and ?ownership?. cas seeks to appoint up to two postdoctoral fellows with expertise in robotics, manipulation, perception, localisation, planning, or related fields; and experience in developing intelligent robotic systems for industry applications, to join a team of researchers working on the project ?an intelligent robotic system for automatic rendering?. as a member of cas and feit, you will contribute to achieving our vision of becoming a leading international technology university. responsibilities: the postdoctoral fellow will contribute to research within the centre for autonomous systems in the uts faculty of engineering & it:   *   work closely with researchers in the team of the project ?an intelligent robotic system for automatic rendering?   *   conduct excellent and high impact research related to the project in the fields of robotics, perception, planning, or the related fields   *   contribute as a team-player within the project team and the research centre   *   assist project chief investigators (cis) to manage research projects uts has a vision to be a world-leading university of technology. we are known for our industry focus, practice-based teaching and learning, and real-world research. with state-of-the-art campuses and facilities, we are preparing students to become global thinkers, leaders and innovators. remuneration salary range: a$101,932 to a$116,641 pa (academic level b) this role attracts 17% superannuation in addition to the base salary. this appointment will be on a 1 year fixed term basis. our commitment to work/life support includes benefits such as flexible work practices, child care centres, generous parental leave and support to carers. how to apply for more information and to apply please click on this link: postdoctoral fellow in perception, localisation and planning of industrial/construction robotics<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__recruitment.uts.edu.au_oa-5fhtml_oa.jsp-3foafunc-3dirc-5fvis-5fvac-5fdisplay-26p-5fsvid-3d115526-26p-5fspid-3d3545675&d=dwmgaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=aupavugokghwvyftvtousrhu4h40sdj6i426naep4j0&s=fyx-dq3yh9xhf28w4iifx7q6eyx3gsxfjkapwweypma&e=>  or visit the uts jobsite (www.uts.edu.au/staff/jobs-uts/working-uts<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uts.edu.au_staff_jobs-2duts_working-2duts&d=dwmgaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=aupavugokghwvyftvtousrhu4h40sdj6i426naep4j0&s=6eikoo56v8wjlcisyxbhaiaoz5k4mfglcbpmm5dbcz8&e=> ) and search by irc115526. specific enquiries regarding the role may be directed to marc carmichael at marc.carmichael at uts.edu.au<mailto:marc.carmichael at uts.edu.au> specific enquiries or issues with your application may be directed to the uts recruitment team on  recruitment at uts.edu.au<mailto:recruitment at uts.edu.au>   or +61 (02) 9514 1080. closing date:  4th february 2019 at 11.59pm subject: research scientist/engineer in field  robotics
content: csiro is australia?s premier government funded research organisation. located at the queensland centre for advanced technology (qcat) in brisbane (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.visitbrisbane.com.au_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lx7lnww0yufp0hzprjcghq8t92bi2trme6cvl2no9la&s=wm3kglrqguubpswgpols9ngt_ywivlv_6xodkojwt10&e=), we conduct cutting-edge field robotics research at the robotics and  autonomous systems group (more info about csiro?s robotics and autonomous systems group: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__research.csiro.au_robotics_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lx7lnww0yufp0hzprjcghq8t92bi2trme6cvl2no9la&s=oasuvuoocgnfbyjwmjbsvtq2kw_9-hnlan4xski3jdk&e=) csiro is seeking to appoint a research scientist/engineer with expertise in navigation, planning and control algorithms for field robots. the types of robots include wheeled, tracked and legged platforms. the position requires someone who is comfortable working with real platforms outdoors and obtaining results beyond simulation, as well being familiar with concepts of system integration, combining hardware and software for robust solutions outdoors. this is an exciting opportunity which requires a high level of competence in navigation, planning and control. additionally, you will also require competence in software engineering using ros/c++. job reference number: 59649 more info and applications: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__jobs.csiro.au_job_brisbane-252c-2dqld-2dresearch-2dscientist-2dengineer-2din-2dfield-2drobotics_531495200_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lx7lnww0yufp0hzprjcghq8t92bi2trme6cvl2no9la&s=pz5jfc7got8wmhhtgpw5tznysevlsiiqds_2w0fo56e&e= navinda kottege phd smieee research team leader | senior research scientist | coordinator ? sixth wave alliance robotics and autonomous systems group | data61 | csiro

subject: postdoctoral fellow job opportunity:  centre for autonomous systems, university of technology sydney (uts),  australia. in-reply-to: <sy2pr01mb27154531b1feb5d777fc2e92cc830@sy2pr01mb2715.ausprd01.prod.outlook.com> references: <sy2pr01mb27154531b1feb5d777fc2e92cc830@sy2pr01mb2715.ausprd01.prod.outlook.com>
content: postdoctoral fellow in perception, localisation and planning of industrial/construction robotics centre for autonomous systems faculty of engineering and information technology, uts an opportunity for up to two (2) early career researchers to join the uts centre for autonomous systems (cas), an internationally acclaimed robotics research group, and to work together with robotics researchers at uts. cas has strong links with researchers and industry locally and abroad. the postdoctoral fellow(s) is expected to contribute to strengthen this relationship. the uts centre for autonomous systems<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.cas.uts.edu.au_&d=dwmgaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=aupavugokghwvyftvtousrhu4h40sdj6i426naep4j0&s=4u1lfwi87bt6dv7anfy11n-gbwzeg04airmwmmxgess&e=> (cas) within the school of mechanical and mechatronic engineering (mme) is an internationally acclaimed robotics research group. cas? vision is to be an internationally recognised leader, at a scale and quality to be globally significant, for robotics research, development and commercial application of autonomous robotics. since its establishment in 2003, cas has demonstrated international leadership in driving research advancements in robotics and in delivering real-world solutions to key challenges facing government, industry and the wider community. examples include the autonomous robots for bridge maintenance and the autonomous bio-inspired climbing robots, both deployed in the sydney harbour bridge. cas currently has over 75 robotics researchers (including phd students) with international reputation in slam, infrastructure robotics, assistive robotics and robot teams. cas has developed a very strong engagement program with industry and governments. cas prides itself on a culture of cooperation, collaboration and ?ownership?. cas seeks to appoint up to two postdoctoral fellows with expertise in robotics, manipulation, perception, localisation, planning, or related fields; and experience in developing intelligent robotic systems for industry applications, to join a team of researchers working on the project ?an intelligent robotic system for automatic rendering?. as a member of cas and feit, you will contribute to achieving our vision of becoming a leading international technology university. responsibilities: the postdoctoral fellow will contribute to research within the centre for autonomous systems in the uts faculty of engineering & it:   *   work closely with researchers in the team of the project ?an intelligent robotic system for automatic rendering?   *   conduct excellent and high impact research related to the project in the fields of robotics, perception, planning, or the related fields   *   contribute as a team-player within the project team and the research centre   *   assist project chief investigators (cis) to manage research projects uts has a vision to be a world-leading university of technology. we are known for our industry focus, practice-based teaching and learning, and real-world research. with state-of-the-art campuses and facilities, we are preparing students to become global thinkers, leaders and innovators. remuneration salary range: a$101,932 to a$116,641 pa (academic level b) this role attracts 17% superannuation in addition to the base salary. this appointment will be on a 1 year fixed term basis. our commitment to work/life support includes benefits such as flexible work practices, child care centres, generous parental leave and support to carers. how to apply for more information and to apply please click on this link: postdoctoral fellow in perception, localisation and planning of industrial/construction robotics<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__recruitment.uts.edu.au_oa-5fhtml_oa.jsp-3foafunc-3dirc-5fvis-5fvac-5fdisplay-26p-5fsvid-3d115526-26p-5fspid-3d3545675&d=dwmgaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=aupavugokghwvyftvtousrhu4h40sdj6i426naep4j0&s=fyx-dq3yh9xhf28w4iifx7q6eyx3gsxfjkapwweypma&e=>  or visit the uts jobsite (www.uts.edu.au/staff/jobs-uts/working-uts<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uts.edu.au_staff_jobs-2duts_working-2duts&d=dwmgaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=aupavugokghwvyftvtousrhu4h40sdj6i426naep4j0&s=6eikoo56v8wjlcisyxbhaiaoz5k4mfglcbpmm5dbcz8&e=> ) and search by irc115526. specific enquiries regarding the role may be directed to marc carmichael at marc.carmichael at uts.edu.au<mailto:marc.carmichael at uts.edu.au> specific enquiries or issues with your application may be directed to the uts recruitment team on  recruitment at uts.edu.au<mailto:recruitment at uts.edu.au>   or +61 (02) 9514 1080. closing date:  4th february 2019 at 11.59pm
