subject: phd positions in flexible mechatronics,  wearable devices, and surgical systems at the university of new south wales,  sydney, australia
content: dear all, phd positions in flexible mechatronics and soft robotics for wearable devices and surgical systems graduate school of biomedical engineering in collaboration with school of mechanical and manufacturing engineering, faculty of engineering, university of new south wales (unsw), sydney, australia is looking for several phd students (3.5-4 years) in projects related to surgical/medical robotics, haptics, and wearable devices starting in semester 3 (sept/2019) or semester 1 (feb/2020) with fully scholarship support including tuition fee and stipend. the deadline for the term 3 intake is 03/may/2019. project 1: flexible/surgical robots this project will focus on the mechanical design, fabrication, modelling, sensing, and control for novel generation miniature flexible robotic arms/catheters with advanced actuation and sensing technologies for flexible endoscopic systems. the robotic systems will also integrate real-time haptic displays to be used in gastrointestinal cancer treatments, heart, and other related diseases. clinical trials on living animals and human will be carried out at the end of the project. the successful candidates are expected to have strong skills and experiences on mechanical design, robotic and flexible mechatronic systems, control, and good hands-on with mechanical fabrication and prototypes, smart materials. this project will collaborate with leading researchers, surgeons, and experts from unsw, local hospitals, international partners. successful candidates should be highly self-motivated to pursue independent and interdisciplinary research. project 2: wearable devices and robotic applications this project will develop strong, multifunctional, and shape programmable soft actuators with embedded sensors for wearable devices and robotic systems to be used in healthcare, vr/ar, rehabilitation, haptics, entertainments, military, and industrial sectors. the successful candidates are expected to have experiences in mechanical design, wearable and embedded electronics, robotic and mechatronic systems, smart materials, and control with good hands-on skills in mechanical and soft material fabrications. this project will collaborate with leading researchers and experts from both australia and overseas. successful candidates should be highly self-motivated to pursue independent and interdisciplinary research. ------------------------------------------------------- minimum requirements:   *   a four-year bachelor's degree with honours class i from an australian institution or equivalent research qualification experience.   *   english tests: (ielts 6.5 with min. 6.0 in all skills; toefl ibt 90 (min. 23 in writing, 22 in reading, listening and speaking); pte academic 64 with min. 54 in each subtest.   *   hdr self-assessment tool: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__selfassessment.research.unsw.edu.au_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0vdxpvyvxyppvqwllgfg7-npuii4nl-mzxz4trqzc6w&s=0ybx56iu8syd-llhxucwfuzd4bgrmcalldx_aop0heu&e= ------------------------------------------------------- details for scholarship please follow these link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__research.unsw.edu.au_international-2dresearch-2dscholarships&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0vdxpvyvxyppvqwllgfg7-npuii4nl-mzxz4trqzc6w&s=g9iefq6ew6k1wll4ta5_0x50-jatsuvhnhpcmij6qms&e= https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__research.unsw.edu.au_domestic-2dresearch-2dscholarships&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0vdxpvyvxyppvqwllgfg7-npuii4nl-mzxz4trqzc6w&s=hqcmnksnuzjsmkhzmr-_sy09fvrv_rsqndfl7voxmfq&e= ------------------------------------------------------- applications: interested students are invited to send their applications with title: [jobs][name of project interest] to dr. thanh nho do via tn.do{at}unsw.edu.au and include: 1) cover letter with your detailed research interest (1-2 pages would be fine) 2) your cv with detailed experiences (previous and current projects, publications) and includes at least two academic references 3) summary (1-2 pages) of bachelor and/or master thesis 4) academic transcripts and certificates of degrees 5) soft copy of your publications if any (e.g. journals, conferences, thesis...) and links if any to illustration photos/videos, developed prototypes, website... 6) proof of english proficiency (toefl, ielts...) that meets minimum requirement from unsw (as above). ------------------------------------------------------- note: only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interviews. ------------------------------------------------------- additional supports: - in additional to unsw scholarships, a top-up allowance per year for 3.5-4 years will be provided for exceptional candidates. - annual travel funds for local/international conferences and to visit collaborators' labs in usa, singapore, and europe. ------------------------------------------------------- about unsw: unsw is one of the top three universities in australia and a research-intensive university ranked in the world's top 50 universities (qs rankings 2018). unsw has all great facilities and excellent staffs needed for world class research. unsw ranks 45th in the 2018 qs world university rankings, 85th in the 2018 times higher education world university rankings, and 36th in the world for academic reputation. unsw is a member of the prestigious group of eight australia's leading research-intensive universities and is australia's most comprehensive research-intensive university, one of only two in the world to be ranked in 50 subject areas in the shanghai ranking's global ranking of academic subjects 2017. the main unsw campus is located in the eastern suburbs of sydney only 7km from the centre of the city, 2km from coogee beach and 5km from sydney's international and domestic airports. about sydney: sydney is a great place to live and enjoy and one of the most beautiful, liveable and friendly cities in the world. the city is among the top fifteen most-visited cities in the world, with millions of tourists coming each year to see the city's landmarks with beautiful beaches and parks. boasting over 1,000,000 ha (2,500,000 acres) of nature reserves and parks, its notable natural features include sydney harbour, the royal national park, royal botanic garden and hyde park, the oldest parkland in the country. built attractions such as the sydney harbour bridge and the world heritage-listed sydney opera house are also well known to international visitors. sydney has an advanced market economy with strengths in finance, manufacturing and tourism. thank you very much. yours sincerely thanh nho do phd scientia lecturer graduate school of biomedical engineering, university of new south wales (unsw) sydney nsw 2052 australia

subject: algorithm developer: optimization
content: dorabot is expanding and hiring for new positions! join us in revolutionizing robotics by applying cutting-edge technology to real world scenarios.  *algorithm developer: optimization  * responsibilities: 1.     analyse problems, formalize given problems as a well-defined optimization problem and design algorithms accordingly. the problem domains include but not limited to layout design, scheduling, task allocation, and packing. 2.     (advanced) customize and implement optimization algorithms into an integrated robotics system. 3.     (advanced) perform theoretical analysis of algorithms. the analysis will be on convergence, completeness, and approximation factors.    requirements: 1.     bachelor or higher degree in one of the following areas (specified in descending order of preferences): a.     optimisation b.     operations research c.     machine learning or actuarial studies 2.     has a solid understanding of basic optimization techniques? 3.     proficient in one of the following computing languages (specified in descending order of preferences): a.     c/c++ b.     python/scheme c.     matlab/r 4.     (bonus) has expertise in combinatorial optimization and/or black-box optimization 5.     (bonus) mathematical modelling. the capability of formalizing a problem to (alphabetical ordering): a.     decision problem b.     numerical optimization problem (e.g., integer/quadratic/convex programming) c.     other standard formalization. here?s a bit about our company: dorabot is an ai and robotics company developing loading, sorting, induction, and transportation solutions for market-leading logistics companies in the us and china. headquartered in shenzhen and backed by some of china's most prominent tech magnates, we're a tight-knit team of visionaries that live and breathe robotics. as e-commerce has exploded, order fulfillment still largely depends on traditional resources. dorabot's advanced solutions allow express couriers to automate, keep up with increasing demand, and fully embrace the future. unique among early-stage chinese startups, dorabot employs people from over 10 different countries and views diversity as a key to their success. among dorabot?s employees are former ups executives and amazon robotics challenge champions from germany and australia. dorabot is currently piloting sorting solutions in the us, which will be rolled out to additional facilities in 2019, followed by our loading and transportation systems. our website: www.dorabot.com what we offer:  -a competitive salary and company equity based on experience and personal contributions -an amazing opportunity to experience life in shenzhen, widely known as china?s silicon valley. shenzhen has the best air quality of any major city in china! -free chinese lessons -free lunches and fresh fruit -an international workplace where english is our working language -on-site company gym -plenty of resources to purchase all kinds of equipment for research and development *dorabot videos:* dorabot solution compilation video - https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__youtu.be_3-2dr9gbgq-2dds&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kgrhwodzsadebg_kjfkvzm0ph6tuzffhnjj6b0d6v9a&s=x1fxg1pf-nscyxcv5drv7ffyhza6uhtpxlzp7iitv_g&e= a short video we put together showcasing our various solutions and technologies for dhl?s robotics day event in germany. dorabot rewind 2018: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_watch-3fv-3dzop88u-2dnrlk&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kgrhwodzsadebg_kjfkvzm0ph6tuzffhnjj6b0d6v9a&s=l9nev45wmqclayxab0gwqsu3x_6ktowocav2awbqjae&e= -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kgrhwodzsadebg_kjfkvzm0ph6tuzffhnjj6b0d6v9a&s=w3tjbgffbrkxmse2s4fhyzjvzd78ria_oybdsdjfb9s&e=

subject: fully-funded phd position in the areas  of robotics and deep learning at csiro and qut, brisbane, australia
content: [jobs] fully-funded phd position in the areas of robotics and deep learning at csiro and qut, brisbane, australia application deadline: march 20, 2019, australian time do you want to work for two of the world's leading research organisations, live in a city with extremely high standard of living, enjoy pristine beaches and sun all year round, and still carry out ground breaking machine learning, robotics research to solve real-world challenges? if so, this position is for you. a fully funded phd position is available as a part of a research collaboration between the robotics and autonomous systems group at the commonwealth scientific and industrial organization (csiro) and the queensland university of technology (qut), in brisbane, australia. you will receive a scholarship of $27,000 per year for 3.5 years. top-up of $10,000 per year will be awarded to outstanding students. deep slam simultaneous localization and mapping (slam) is a key enabling component of driverless vehicles, robotics and augmented reality. slam goal is to estimate pose of the vehicle and simultaneously generate dense 3d scene reconstruction. at csiro we have developed and deployed state-of-the-art 3d lidar-based slam systems for the past decade. there is a new direction of research at the intersection of deep learning and geometry-based 3d slam. the research in this phd programme will develop algorithms for geometry-based deep learning slam in a dynamic and unstructured environment. the phd programme will involve the development of self or semi-supervised learning methods to address the significant weakness of most current deep networks. position requirements: - must: a bachelor?s degree with the first class honours or a master?s degree with research in a relevant area in the past 5 years (e.g., computer science, electrical engineering, mechatronics, physics or other related fields) - strong competencies in one or more of the followings areas: robotics, computer vision, machine learning, deep learning. - demonstrated strong programming skills in c++ or python in linux. - demonstrated research experience (for example, a good publication record) - experience in robot operating system, pytorch, tensorflow how to apply: prospective students should send the following documents in a single pdf file to dr. peyman moghadam (peyman.moghadam at csiro.au) with the subject [phd deep slam] - one page cover letter explaining your research background and interests, - latest cv or resume, - latest transcript about the robotics and autonomous systems and csiro the robotics and autonomous systems at csiro has over 80 scientists and researchers, and is a world leader in its field. it develops foundational and applied research in robotics, computer vision, distributed sensing and sensor networks, and autonomous systems for a broad range of domains. it has very well?equipped laboratories with strong engineering support, and a variety of aerial, aquatic, wheeled and legged robotic research platforms. the phd projects will be conducted with joint supervision of csiro and qut researchers. the commonwealth scientific and industrial research organisation (csiro) is australia?s national science agency and one of the largest and most diverse research organisations in the world. research spans five broad areas: information and communications; manufacturing, materials and minerals; environment; energy; and food, health and life sciences. csiro provides a highly innovative and dynamic research environment, and is positioned in the top 1% of global research institutions in 14 of 22 research fields and in the top 0.1% in four research fields. for more information about csiro?s autonomous systems program visit: subject: fully-funded phd position in the  hyperspectral deep learning at csiro and qut, brisbane, australia
content: [jobs] fully-funded phd position in the hyperspectral deep learning at csiro and qut, brisbane, australia application deadline: march 20, 2019, australian time do you want to work for two of the world's leading research organisations, live in a city with extremely high standard of living, enjoy pristine beaches and sun all year round, and still carry out ground breaking machine learning, robotics research to solve real-world challenges? if so, this position is for you. a fully funded phd position is available as a part of a research collaboration between the robotics and autonomous systems group at the commonwealth scientific and industrial organization (csiro) and the queensland university of technology (qut), in brisbane, australia. you will receive a scholarship of $37,000 per year for 3.5 years. hyperspectral deep learning hyperspectral cameras are currently undergoing a change from bulky and expensive equipment towards mobile and portable devices. a hyperspectral camera comprises of hundreds of bands with shortwave dependencies. compare to conventional colour cameras (rgb bands), one could use these shortwave dependencies to design and develop a deep network for object classification, semantic segmentation and scene understanding. both spectral and spatial relationship needs to be modelled by the deep networks simultaneously. the research in this phd programme will develop algorithms for hyperspectral deep learning.  the phd programme will involve the development of learning with self-supervision algorithms to address the significant weakness of most current deep networks. position requirements: - must: a bachelor?s degree with the first class honours or a master?s degree with research in a relevant area in the past 5 years (e.g., computer science, electrical engineering, mechatronics, physics or other related fields) - strong competencies in one or more of the followings areas: computer vision, machine learning, deep learning, robotics. - demonstrated strong programming skills in c++ or python in linux. - demonstrated research experience (for example, a good publication record) - experience in pytorch, tensorflow how to apply: prospective students should send the following documents in a single pdf file to dr. peyman moghadam (peyman.moghadam at csiro.au<mailto:peyman.moghadam at csiro.au>) with the subject [phd hyperspectral] - one page cover letter explaining your research background and interests, - latest cv or resume, - latest transcript about the robotics and autonomous systems and csiro the robotics and autonomous systems at csiro has over 80 scientists and researchers, and is a world leader in its field. it develops foundational and applied research in robotics, computer vision, distributed sensing and sensor networks, and autonomous systems for a broad range of domains. it has very well?equipped laboratories with strong engineering support, and a variety of aerial, aquatic, wheeled and legged robotic research platforms. the phd projects will be conducted with joint supervision of csiro and qut researchers. the commonwealth scientific and industrial research organisation (csiro) is australia?s national science agency and one of the largest and most diverse research organisations in the world. research spans five broad areas: information and communications; manufacturing, materials and minerals; environment; energy; and food, health and life sciences. csiro provides a highly innovative and dynamic research environment, and is positioned in the top 1% of global research institutions in 14 of 22 research fields and in the top 0.1% in four research fields. for more information about csiro?s autonomous systems program visit: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__research.csiro.au_robotics_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=27feuru3kkmhnmjiuwme0xx_fvdw-q8op5dkjfekjk0&s=fapcr6dbviffuogy9tfdzppqoxfqz3q3xyxzxv0auxm&e= and for more information about csiro visit: subject: postdoctoral researchers in  optimisation and scheduling for autonomous mining at rtcma/acfr,  university of sydney, australia
content: the rio tinto centre for mine automation, a group within the australian centre for field robotics at the university of sydney have several research-focussed postdoctoral positions open. since 2007, the centre?s focus has been on applying fundamental research to real-world problems in the mining domain. we have a strong and long-standing relationship with rio tinto and a record of successful translation of research into industry. the centre is currently funded through to 2021. as an applied-research centre, we have a mix of academic researchers and software engineers to facilitate translation of ideas into production systems. further software development positions will be forthcoming. stochastic fleet optimisation researcher (447/0319f)<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__sydney.nga.net.au_-3fjati-3de6f72325-2d3785-2dc188-2de795-2dad19bfb832b5&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=everswyiub1dir1mb50rovnraufvotp49a_2gqrqb-e&s=j3ak_buo6fevkktg0vrthjk2iqe-6qsht_1_cxosz-w&e=> we are currently seeking a self-motivated and well-qualified researcher to contribute to theoretical and applied optimisation research, with a focus on optimisation of mining equipment and agents across complex systems. the work will include data-driven modelling of equipment and process performance. this will provide an exceptional opportunity to work closely with academia and rio tinto at the intersection of fundamental research into field-robotics and mine operations. you will be expected to build research areas, engage in academic publication of research, and may also have the opportunity to teach at postgraduate and industry levels. applications and more information: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__sydney.nga.net.au_-3fjati-3de6f72325-2d3785-2dc188-2de795-2dad19bfb832b5&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=everswyiub1dir1mb50rovnraufvotp49a_2gqrqb-e&s=j3ak_buo6fevkktg0vrthjk2iqe-6qsht_1_cxosz-w&e= data science researcher (521/0319f)<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__sydney.nga.net.au_-3fjati-3d54a4c7cd-2df044-2dd139-2d848c-2dad19bfa04c75&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=everswyiub1dir1mb50rovnraufvotp49a_2gqrqb-e&s=4u4cxyo6q6m4hapz_0up12s-ivawmrsrjjp9tn7rpgs&e=> we are currently seeking a self-motivated and well-qualified data science researcher to contribute to the theoretical and applied tasks of the asset optimisation research group, with a focus on data-driven modelling of equipment and process performance, using machine learning and data analytics techniques. the ability to deploy machine learning techniques will rely on provable performance or operating bounds, which will also form an important part of this research. this will provide an exceptional opportunity to work closely with academia and rio tinto at the intersection of fundamental research into field-robotics and mine operations. you will be expected to build research areas, engage in academic publication of research, and may also have the opportunity to teach at postgraduate and industry levels. applications and more information: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__sydney.nga.net.au_-3fjati-3d54a4c7cd-2df044-2dd139-2d848c-2dad19bfa04c75&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=everswyiub1dir1mb50rovnraufvotp49a_2gqrqb-e&s=4u4cxyo6q6m4hapz_0up12s-ivawmrsrjjp9tn7rpgs&e= subject: fully funded phd positions in assistive  and rehabilitation robotics (university of melbourne, australia)
content: the university of melbourne is seeking to recruit up to 6 phd students to join the university of melbourne and fourier intelligence joint laboratory (blogs.unimelb.edu.au/fouriermelbrobotics<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__blogs.unimelb.edu.au_fouriermelbrobotics&d=dwmf-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=v_k7sfjfhnuljh0vausejg-ikhu1ose44kkh7myyovu&s=3ixrzokuxnprdnavaj0udhoqqifs0pkymbrh2fiw1tg&e=>) - part of the human-robotics laboratory (blogs.unimelb.edu.au/human-robotics<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__blogs.unimelb.edu.au_human-2drobotics&d=dwmf-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=v_k7sfjfhnuljh0vausejg-ikhu1ose44kkh7myyovu&s=qx9a4wxovziae6ngho_jclvdouat8yblhysns6fsr-g&e=>). about the lab the laboratory focuses on the fundamental research and the capability development in assistive and rehabilitative robotics, with an emphasis on having real world impact. a collaboration between the university of melbourne and high-growth startup fourier intelligence, the laboratory is ideally positioned to develop ideas with accelerated implementation into products. projects two projects are offered: 1) upper limb rehabilitation robotics rehabilitation robots have been widely developed in the last decades to physically assist with rehabilitation of individuals with neurological impairment but their adoption remains limited. this project seeks to guide the improvement and adoption of upper limb rehabilitation robotics by asking two key questions. first, "what does the robot need to do?" - identifying and exploration of key neurological issues and potential treatment opportunities. secondly, "how does the robot need to do it?" - addressing key usability aspects to accelerate the adoption of robotic devices. the experimental part of the project will specifically leverage the use of the melbourne-developed emu and fourier m2 platforms available in the laboratory. 2) lower limb assistive exoskeletons this project aims to develop a lower limb exoskeleton to assist a paraplegic to walk, whilst maintaining a lightweight design. this will be achieved by including sensors and actuators not traditionally consider part of the exoskeleton - such as crutches - in the control structure and algorithms. the fourier intelligence x2 platform, will be used for the development and testing of this approach. students in this project may also be involved in the laboratory's entry into the 2020 cybathlon in zurich. about the position prospective phd candidates will be fully funded, including a aud30,600 per year living allowance for up to 4 years. the phd students will be part of a cohort starting the program at similar times. the cohort will be offered additional training programs outside those offered in a standard phd program, and a sense of community throughout the phd program. about the university of melbourne: the university of melbourne is consistently ranked among the leading universities in the world, at number 1 in australia and number 32 in the world (times higher education world university rankings 2017-2018).  we are globally engaged, comprehensive, research-intensive and committed to respond to the major social, economic and environmental challenges of our time. how to apply interested applicants are asked to email a/prof. denny oetomo (doetomo at unimelb.edu.au<mailto:doetomo at unimelb.edu.au>) and dr justin fong (fong.j at unimelb.edu.au<mailto:fong.j at unimelb.edu.au>) with a cv and cover letter explaining your interest and background in the preferred project.

*open phd position in robotics at university of wollongong, australia.  * a fully funded phd position is available in robotics at the school of mechanical, materials, mechatronic and biomedical engineering, university of wollongong, nsw, australia. we conduct research on: ?	compliant and soft robot design and control; rehabilitation, prosthesis and surgery robotics; robot-human interaction; haptics; teleoperation and locomotion.  required: ?	bachelor?s degree in mechanical engineering, mechatronic engineering, biomedical engineering, control engineering or a related field;  ?	excellent writing and communication skills; ?	english proficiency. preferred: ?	master?s degree; ?	experience in mechanical design software such as catia and solid works;  ?	experience in real-time control systems; ?	experience in robotic projects; ?	proficiency in matlab and c; ?	demonstrated research experience (i.e., a good publication record, completed projects etc.). how to apply:  send the following documents in a single pdf file  ?	one-page cover letter describing your interest, goal, and how your background fits well;  ?	cv or resume;  ?	transcripts;  to ?emre at uow.edu.au?.   dr. emre sariyildiz: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__scholars.uow.edu.au_display_emre-5fsariyildiz&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ihhqlwqz72piehoydhzfkpzy4_rapi_zrtz4_kc93dm&s=-czfoyh59qypdeiamxebymynslepmpl5oahoeovlnlm&e=. about university of wollongong: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.uow.edu.au_about_index.html&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ihhqlwqz72piehoydhzfkpzy4_rapi_zrtz4_kc93dm&s=deyzobzldomtjwwcls2q64hupqhlmtfjorlohgbob_u&e= the university of wollongong is a research-intensive university with an outstanding reputation for its learning environments across a broad range of disciplines. our commitment to our students is evident in our graduates, who are recognised for their capability, quality and success in the global workplace. uow is an international network of campuses and regional learning centres. together with our partners, we make a strong and connected presence in our communities. we are a young and vibrant university with undiminished ambitions. we value our research capacity to work on complex interdisciplinary problems. our spirit of inquiry drives our research and learning environments and our objective of earning a place in the top 1% of the world's universities. -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ihhqlwqz72piehoydhzfkpzy4_rapi_zrtz4_kc93dm&s=ljotehswyos4iuqbiug-dsontxkqeeqly37vvex8smg&e=

subject: software engineer @ dorabot inc.  atlanta, us
content: we are looking for a talented and experienced software engineer! *job description* 1. implement robotics algorithms 2. integrate software parts and library to the robot system 3. maintain related functions and keep it stable * position requirement* 1. skilled with linux development environment 2. focus on code style and software engineering 3. skilled with git 4. very skilled with c++, have knowledge of new standards such as c++11, c++14, etc. should be familiar with the following functions:  - pointer and smart pointer;  - memory alignment and memory management;  - stl, boost;  - oop;  - c++ template;  - linux management tools, be able to write some simple shell scripts  - toolchain and development environment setup, be able to write and modify makefile *who we are* dorabot is an ai and robotics company developing loading, sorting, induction, and transportation solutions for market-leading logistics companies in the us and asia. headquartered in shenzhen and backed by some of the most prominent tech magnates, we're a tight-knit team of visionaries that live and breathe robotics. as e-commerce has exploded, order fulfillment still largely depends on traditional resources. dorabot's advanced solutions allow express couriers to automate, keep up with increasing demand, and fully embrace the future. unique among early-stage asian startups, dorabot employs people from over 10 different countries and views diversity as a key to their success. among dorabot?s employees are former ups executives and amazon robotics challenge champions from germany and australia. dorabot is currently piloting sorting solutions in the us, which will be rolled out to additional facilities in 2019, followed by our loading and transportation systems. our website: *www.dorabot.com <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.dorabot.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eyloj-ownbquzcaohbr_jnp9idojhx_2yuip1qxosk8&s=xasbcna87j5vwe3tcucqn65-bqj38fwl5bvm1shgzss&e=>* subject: software engineer @ dorabot inc.  atlanta, us
content: we aim to gather the smartest robot enthusiasts to build a fully autonomous robot that can see and operate in the human environment, bring a true robotic future to life. now, we are looking for a talented and experienced software engineer based in atlanta, us. *job description* 1. implement robotics algorithms 2. integrate software parts and library to the robot system 3. maintain related functions and keep it stable * position requirement* 1. skilled with linux development environment 2. focus on code style and software engineering 3. skilled with git 4. very skilled with c++, have knowledge of new standards such as c++11, c++14, etc. should be familiar with the following functions:  - pointer and smart pointer;  - memory alignment and memory management;  - stl, boost;  - oop;  - c++ template;  - linux management tools, be able to write some simple shell scripts  - toolchain and development environment setup, be able to write and modify makefile *who we are* dorabot is an ai and robotics company developing loading, sorting, induction, and transportation solutions for market-leading logistics companies in the us and asia. headquartered in shenzhen and backed by some of the most prominent tech magnates, we're a tight-knit team of visionaries that live and breathe robotics. as e-commerce has exploded, order fulfillment still largely depends on traditional resources. dorabot's advanced solutions allow express couriers to automate, keep up with increasing demand, and fully embrace the future. unique among early-stage asian startups, dorabot employs people from over 10 different countries and views diversity as a key to their success. among dorabot?s employees are former ups executives and amazon robotics challenge champions from germany and australia. dorabot is currently piloting sorting solutions in the us, which will be rolled out to additional facilities in 2019, followed by our loading and transportation systems. our website: subject: - kyburz opportunity - lead mechanical  engineer autonomous driving
content: position:  lead mechanical engineer autonomous driving location: freienstein, switzerland *about us* kyburz switzerland is a swiss sme with just over 100 employees based near zurich with locations in germany and australia. kyburz develops, produces, sells, and services electric vehicles for last mile delivery and niche personal mobility.  *about the job* we are looking for a dynamic engineer to lead the autonomous systems development activities at kyburz switzerland. we are developing a line of self-driving delivery vehicles for several customers and have an opening for motivated engineers of any age, gender, or religion. please see some of our previous platforms: mobile depot box: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__kyburz-2dswitzerland.ch_en_auto-5fet-5fii-5fprototype&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=fap9glrk4ph5tplqywjrhricpuhsbkylewwswbiwkma&s=dlcqzyvd_zafsp6qpdvylk3boyp-ueihpsem6nerqd8&e= autonomous delivery agent: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__kyburz-2dswitzerland.ch_en_auto-5fet-5fiii-5fprototype&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=fap9glrk4ph5tplqywjrhricpuhsbkylewwswbiwkma&s=yyvjaaikquctiqzoxwl3v3odavkohjj-xh2dg_cw1tc&e= *your responsibilities* -research and development of autonomous vehicle platforms -conception of new vehicle concepts for deployment as self-driving delivery systems -hardware specification, ideation, drawing, construction, and commissioning -testing and evaluation of hardware and software developments -leadership and planning activities in autonomous systems development --self-directed implementation and documentation of development activities --measurement of success and testing of research hypothesis *your profile* -bachelors or master?s degree in mechanical, mechatronics, or control engineering or related -specialization in vehicle engineering, mobilty, or autonomous and robotic systems -experience in the design, commissioning, and testing of robots -strong background in cad (particularly solidworks) -experience in software development (matlab/simulink, c, python) -knowledge in specifications development, including validation and verification of designs -speak and write in german and english fluently *what we offer* -opportunities to develop your skills in a future-oriented and market leading sme -an interesting and varied working environment -the opportunity to contribute to a cleaner and more sustainable transportation future are you interested in long-term prospects at an innovative company? we await your application to our motivated, energetic, friendly, and competent team, and are looking forward to meeting you! *to apply* please send all your application materials via email to: kyburz switzerland ag barbara vetsch personaladministration shedweg 2-8 8427 freienstein barbara.vetsch at kyburz-switzerland.ch www.kyburz-switzerland.ch

subject: phd position: university of queensland,  australia
content: the school of mechanical & mining engineering has one phd open position in learning control algorithms for field robots in unstructured environments. about the award nowadays, the complexity in the design of robotic systems increases enormously due to the fact that human beings desire a higher level of intelligence and autonomy. additionally, it is important that the developed systems must be capable of autonomously adapting to the variations in the operating environment while maintaining the overall objective to accomplish tasks even in highly uncertain and unstructured environments. such robotic systems must display the ability to learn from experience, adapt themselves to the changing environment and seamlessly integrate information to-and-from humans. the doctoral student will work in the intersection of the areas of robotics and automatic control. we are looking for a qualified and enthusiastic phd student who wishes to investigate the embedded guidance, control and navigation algorithms for unmanned systems (e.g., model predictive control, adaptive control, concurrent learning, etc.). selection criteria - hold a master degree in mechanical, mechatronics, electrical engineering or related fields. - strong background on control theory - hands-on experience on robotic systems eligibility australian citizens, australian permanent residents and nz citizens can apply. to be eligible to apply you must meet the entry requirements for higher degrees by research at uq, please visit the graduate school's website. how to apply to apply for admission and scholarship, follow the link below: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__scholarships.uq.edu.au_scholarship_learning-2dcontrol-2dalgorithms-2dfor-2dfield-2drobots-2din-2dunstructured-2denvironments-2dphd&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=uhgthtofjmhjerubivamfwnv7n5synco4n1jf3xia5i&s=9qlyjvkgfbkqnhgucdc2t_v-x2ptm32mdxpdalc_-na&e= there is no separate application for scholarship because you will be given the opportunity to request scholarship consideration on the application for admission. prior to applying, check your eligibility and prepare your documentation. you should contact  dr erkan kayacan (e.kayacan at uq.edu.au<mailto:e.kayacan at uq.edu.au>) to discuss your suitability for this scholarship prior to submitting an application and email him the following documents: - a detailed curriculum vitae - a motivation letter, including a brief description of past experience - copies of diploma and transcripts of bachelor and master degrees. - at least three references available to contact. applications close: 12 may 2019 dr. erkan kayacan lecturer - mechatronic engineering school of mechanical & mining engineering the university of queensland brisbane qld 4072 australia t +61 7 3365 74673 e e.kayacan at uq.edu.au<mailto:e.kayacan at uq.edu.au> w www.erkank.net<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.erkank.net_&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=uhgthtofjmhjerubivamfwnv7n5synco4n1jf3xia5i&s=3j0dcy_mqn9azpxtm7koissh25vghqwvzd-fq9zynvs&e=> cricos code: 00025b [https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__anif.org.au_wp-2dcontent_uploads_uq-2dlogo.jpg.png&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=uhgthtofjmhjerubivamfwnv7n5synco4n1jf3xia5i&s=xoe6agu0anf8uz2zgrfmsjrnwza1_dbvdouhtllmg4s&e=]

subject: research scientist in field robotics
content: csiro is australia?s premier government funded research organisation. located in brisbane, we conduct cutting-edge field robotics research at the robotics and  autonomous systems group. we are looking for an expert in robotic navigation and planning to work on our darpa subterranean challenge team. csiro is one of the 7 funded teams competing in this challenge which is focused on multi-agent exploration and artefact detection in a gps-denied, communications degraded, complex subterranean environment.  you will get a chance to apply your navigation and planning expertise to develop cutting-edge algorithms on wheeled, tracked and legged robot platforms. this permanent (tenured) position requires someone who has a phd in robotics or a related field, is competent in software engineering using ros/c++, comfortable working with real platforms outdoors and obtaining results beyond simulation. it is highly desirable if you are familiar with concepts of system integration, combining hardware and software for robust solutions outdoors. this is an exciting opportunity to work alongside a team of highly motivated scientists and engineers pushing the boundaries of what is achievable. if you are interested, please contact navinda kottege (navinda.kottege at csiro.au<mailto:navinda.kottege at csiro.au>) for more information. if you are in montreal, come and talk to the csiro team at ieee icra 20-24 may 2019. looking forward to hearing from you! navinda kottege phd smieee research team leader ? dynamic platforms | senior research scientist robotics and autonomous systems group | data61 | csiro

subject: research fellow - robotics @ monash  university australia
content: *research fellow - robotics* *job no.: *594196 *location: *clayton campus *employment type: *full-time *duration:* 2 year fixed-term appointment *remuneration: *$68,040 - $92,343 pa level a (plus 9.5% employer superannuation)    - *be inspired, every day*    - *drive your own learning at one of the world?s top 80 universities*    - *take your career in exciting, rewarding directions* everyone needs a platform to launch a satisfying career. at monash, we give you the space and support to take your career in all kinds of exciting new directions. you?ll have access to quality research, infrastructure and learning facilities, opportunities to collaborate internationally, as well as the grants you?ll need to publish your work. we?re a university full of energetic and enthusiastic minds, driven to challenge what?s expected, expand what we know, and learn from other inspiring, empowering thinkers. *the opportunity* the department of electrical and computer systems engineering is seeking a research fellow with a particular interest in robot learning, interactive learning and a willingness to research long term autonomy in human environments. as the research fellow, you will utilise your strong research and analytical skills and ability to solve complex problems to make significant contributions to the research efforts of the team. you will have the unique opportunity to develop research proposals and supervise junior researchers. you will have excellent organisational capabilities, outstanding verbal and written communication skills and a demonstrated ability to work as part of a team. the ideal candidate will hold a phd in electrical, computer or mechatronics engineering, computer science or a closely related field. this role is a full-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated. at monash university, we are committed to being a child safe organisation. some positions at the university will require the incumbent to hold a valid working with children check. your application must address the selection criteria. please refer to "how to apply for monash jobs <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.monash.edu_jobs_how-2dto-2dapply_applying-2dfor-2dthe-2djob&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=f6g-nqzuwm8_yerzmu-42uzbxcr-1ssjumvtx5mbhsu&s=gn02u-achymm4u9tedzhjmqv5wgf_itbrlkjlo6gm7q&e= >". *enquiries* professor dana kulic, electrical & computer systems engineering, dana.kulic at monash.edu *position description* [image: download file] research fellow - robotics <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__secure.dc2.pageuppeople.com_apply_transferrichtextfile.ashx-3fsdata-3dufutvjmtfvma33sxhcbph0jqoakqkvb0hpwxsfcaws1nnrpxotfqmpw-5flf064cz-2dxidbpkq9s2fcuuhua9t1ski5r-2dbwpbwhavht0q-2dlugmwdnr9v64h6-2dp2ipdt6aywlkxvxywt4ypkxmwqcxgv9smwjklzxq-257e-257e&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=f6g-nqzuwm8_yerzmu-42uzbxcr-1ssjumvtx5mbhsu&s=kr7i20xzku5qewayibyzy868bs4ocksxogtndeignd0&e= > *closing date* thursday 25 july 2019, 11:55 pm aest *to read more or to apply, please visit:* https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.pageuppeople.com_513_cw_en_job_594196_research-2dfellow-2drobotics&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=f6g-nqzuwm8_yerzmu-42uzbxcr-1ssjumvtx5mbhsu&s=satlqbqdytlh2bykhjwxeox4cgkrlg89jnonqhyqkv8&e=

subject: phd position on robot grasping @ aau  klagenfurt, austria
content: the institute of smart system technologies, sensors and actuators group,  faculty of technical sciences at alpen-adria-universitaet klagenfurt is  seeking to make the following appointment: ====================================================================== phd position in robot grasping - tactile sensing and proximity perception ====================================================================== *** duties and responsibilities *** - collaboration with scientific and industrial partners of the  institute, e.g. www.cap-size.at - independent research with the aim to submit a dissertation and to  acquire a phd - assistance in public relations activities *** recruitment conditions *** - a university degree (master or diplom-ingenieur) in the field of  electrical engineering and information technology, mechanical  engineering, computer science or a related subject, graded with  excellent academic success and corresponding knowledge in the field. - proven programming skills in at least one of the languages matlab, c /  c ++, python, ros - fluent in english both spoken and written - social and communication skills, ability to work independently *** additional (optional) qualifications*** - experience in one of the following fields: -- multiphysical modeling and simulation of sensors and actuators -- capacitive, time of flight, radar or other proximity sensors -- design of (computer) experiments -- additive manufacturing -- machine learning -- wireless transducers - relevant (international) practical experience - scientific publications the minimum gross monthly salary for this assignment amounts to ?  2.854,50 (14 x p.a., temporary contract for 3 years, scheme b1, 100%  employment, 40 hours/week) and can increase in accordance with the  provisions of the collective agreement in the case of consideration of  previous occupational experience. the scheduled start of the employment  is as soon as possible. the alpen-adria-universitaet klagenfurt intends to increase the number  of women on its faculty, particularly high-level positions, and  therefore specifically invites applications by women. among equally  qualified applicants women will receive preferential consideration. people with disabilities or chronic diseases who are qualified are  explicitly invited to apply. in the "sensors and actuators" group, we seek to push the current bounds  in sensor design and optimization, autarkic wireless sensors, sensors in  robotics and near field sensing. the group publishes in international  top journals and conference proceedings. successful applicants will be  encouraged and supported to publish their work in such journals and  proceedings and will have the opportunity to cooperate with our world  renowned international partners from science and industry. our network  comprises partners in europe, north and south america, australia and  asia. we specifically encourage and support close and open collaboration  with our peers both internationally and at the university. our young  research group provides a highly dynamic and friendly attitude and thus  a collaborative and inspiring work environment with highly modern  infrastructure, which is continuously updated and upgraded. for further information please contact prof. hubert zangl,  hubert.zangl at aau.at or visit our website at www.aau.at/sat.

subject: fully funded phd studentship for dual  awards at the university of hertfordshire, uk,  and university of western sydney, australia
content: dear colleagues, please help us spread the word about this unique opportunity for a dual award phd studentship: a single studentship is available for an exceptional candidate with interest in ambient assisted living and activity monitoring domain. the bursary is a ?15,009 per annum plus the payment of the student fees. applicants are only eligible from the uk or eu. the phds are to start in october 2019. background and context: our previous work in accompany project (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__doi.org_10.2478_pjbr-2d2013-2d0007&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=piut5qrib7wiqvcygo6ocvlagg1anpjyy13dmrcsdmq&s=kznwwh4a_rg3hnqpvi0wbeqk2kgca9wl-dgnt3ix7hy&e= ) and recent collaboration with the north hertfordshire county council, focuses on person and activity detection in ambient assisted living scenarios. the next natural progression in this work is to improve on the technological readiness of systems for deployment in supervised and unsupervised settings. this involves working on detection algorithms fidelity, as well as user interfaces for the triad of care namely the person under care, their relatives and the service provider.   the goal here is to detect people and everyday objects and what people do with objects. this then serves as a repository of activities that are automatically detected in support of independent living. the phd involves both elements of robotics and artificial intelligence, thus to enable accurate detection of activities in a robot-mediated interaction scenario. the phd candidate will be working under my supervision, but please note that this phd is part of a dual award phd with the western sydney university in australia and is co-supervised with prof gu fang. the dual award means that the candidate will submit their thesis to two doctorate degrees, one from the uk, and one from australia. to support this, during the second year of the phd, the student is placed in sydney in order to explore existing knowledge and expertise in robotic for manufacturing and to apply that to the home companion domain. about us: the university of hertfordshire provides a very stimulating environment, offering a large number of specialised and interdisciplinary seminars as well as general training and researcher development opportunities. the university  is situated in hatfield, in the green belt just north of london. how to apply for informal queries please email<mailto:fa08aap at herts.ac.uk> me, but note that you must apply for the positions to be considered for the studentships. download the application form<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.herts.ac.uk_-5f-5fdata_assets_pdf-5ffile_0010_31105_uh-2dapplication-2dform.pdf&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=piut5qrib7wiqvcygo6ocvlagg1anpjyy13dmrcsdmq&s=wrxmq3p2im6jyhxjapzmvieri8btbprpkue8_kgkmvs&e= >. please note: you must download the application form to your computer before you complete it. if you complete the form in the browser window, the information you have entered may be lost when the form is saved. the application form should be returned to: lynette spelman and emma thorogood research student administrators university of hertfordshire college lane hatfield, herts al10 9ab tel: +44 (0)1707 286083 doctoralcollegeadmissions at herts.ac.uk<mailto:doctoralcollegeadmissions at herts.ac.uk> applications should also include two references and transcripts of previous academic degrees. we accept applications for self-funded places throughout the year. the next short-listing process for studentship applications will begin on 21 july 2019 with interviews planned between 25-26 july 2019. farshid amirabdollahian professor of human-robot interaction adaptive systems research group university of hertfordshire hatfield al10 9ab united kingdom

subject: research fellow - robotics @ monash  university, australia
content: *research fellow - robotics* *job no.: *594196 *location: *clayton campus *employment type: *full-time *duration:* 2 year fixed-term appointment *remuneration: *$68,040 - $92,343 pa level a (plus 9.5% employer superannuation)    - *be inspired, every day*    - *drive your own learning at one of the world?s top 80 universities*    - *take your career in exciting, rewarding directions* everyone needs a platform to launch a satisfying career. at monash, we give you the space and support to take your career in all kinds of exciting new directions. you?ll have access to quality research, infrastructure and learning facilities, opportunities to collaborate internationally, as well as the grants you?ll need to publish your work. we?re a university full of energetic and enthusiastic minds, driven to challenge what?s expected, expand what we know, and learn from other inspiring, empowering thinkers. *the opportunity* the department of electrical and computer systems engineering is seeking a research fellow with a particular interest in robot learning, interactive learning and a willingness to research long term autonomy in human environments. as the research fellow, you will utilise your strong research and analytical skills and ability to solve complex problems to make significant contributions to the research efforts of the team. you will have the unique opportunity to develop research proposals and supervise junior researchers. you will have excellent organisational capabilities, outstanding verbal and written communication skills and a demonstrated ability to work as part of a team. the ideal candidate will hold a phd in electrical, computer or mechatronics engineering, computer science or a closely related field. this role is a full-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated. at monash university, we are committed to being a child safe organisation. some positions at the university will require the incumbent to hold a valid working with children check. your application must address the selection criteria. *enquiries* professor dana kulic, electrical & computer systems engineering, dana.kulic at monash.edu *closing date* thursday 25 july 2019, 11:55 pm aest *for further information or to apply, please view; * https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.pageuppeople.com_513_cw_en_job_594196_research-2dfellow-2drobotics&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=itplxwqvlgfcxafmfm0hh-pogmbpbqe3qlhnufepalw&s=5uym2mfulodsjnc7ozieeaofx2yqgh5kvzmqpfseaea&e=

subject: phd position in the domain of  incremental learning for object of interest classification (jointly funded  by france & australia)
content: a phd position is immediately available in the domain of incremental  learning for object of interest classification in the context of a  trilateral collaboration between labsticc (ensta bretagne and imt  atlantique), naval group and flinders university in adelaide, australia.  the 3-year doctoral scholarship aims to advance the state-of-the-art in  incremental learning for object of interest classification from imagery  acquired by aerial, underwater or terrestrial drones/robots. full details related to the detailed subject of the thesis and the  candidature procedure are available in: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.ensta-2dbretagne.fr_clement_phd-5filcoi.pdf&d=dwicaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=fcvjcrhwslk7c2iaop6vhbbtablgas5z5ecmqt_ckye&s=wkmv1nz9cbkdswooxepfuj9motgjlnn1pkgxtrtoi7i&e=  expected starting date of the thesis is from septembre/october 2019. interested applicants should contact quentin oliveau  (quentin.oliveau at naval-group.com) and benoit clement  (benoit.clement at ensta-bretagne.fr) by email with the reference [ilcoi] --  panagiotis papadakis associate professor https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__sites.google.com_site_pgpapadakis_&d=dwicaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=fcvjcrhwslk7c2iaop6vhbbtablgas5z5ecmqt_ckye&s=jneuqd9z4pludbso5lf7aojojzgtmd9zbzsqd38capq&e=  imt atlantique, brest, france

subject: 3-year ra in activeai for uavs -  university of sheffield, uk
content: are you a talented and ambitious computer scientist, computational neuroscientist or machine learner? are you looking for an opportunity to develop the next generation ai algorithms that are required to realise the third wave of ai? we have a rare opportunity for a research associate to work on this problem within the dept of computer science at the university of sheffield (a world top 100 university) and in collaboration with world-leading neuroscientists in australia through the prestigious ?1.2m epsrc centre to centre project (activeai: active learning and selective attention for rapid, robust and efficient ai). your primary role will be to develop a new class of activeai controllers for problems in which insects excel but deep learning methods struggle. these problems have one or more of the following characteristics: (i) learning must occur rapidly, (ii) learning samples are few or costly, (iii) computational resources are limited, and (iv) the learning problem changes over time. insects deal with such complex tasks robustly despite limited computational power because learning is an active process emerging from the interaction of evolved brains, bodies and behaviours. through a virtuous cycle of modelling and experiments, you will develop insect-inspired models, in which behavioural strategies and specialised sensors actively structure sensory input while selective attention drives learning to the most salient information, massively reducing the search space. in this way, we will both advance neuroscience and enable activeai solutions which are efficient in learning and final network configuration, robust to real-world conditions and learn rapidly. you will work under the supervision of dr mike mangan, and professors eleni vasilaki and james marshall, within the department of computer science (top five in the uk in the most recent ref) in partnership with uk-based research collaborators in the ?4.8m epsrc brains on board programme grant. you will also lead a new collaboration with world-leading research partners in australia (led by prof andrew barron, macquarie university) through extended secondments. you should be educated to phd level (or be close to completion) in a related computational field (or equivalent industrial experience), with excellent skills in computational modelling, ideally the use of neural networks to either model biological systems or to solve complex tasks. previous experience of gpu computing, embedding models onto robots, verification of models through neuroscientific or behavioural assays, are desirable although not essential, but candidates must have an aptitude for learning or improving these skills. the formal advert with application guidelines can be found here -> https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__tiny.cc_gq268y&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=pw0k0hke3-iu-um8yjsqk8ccqfoxjuu4pese4fewzjy&s=rvkclmcrr8aafy-fdqwn5dvl925odqjj2sleg4x_vno&e=  --  dr. mike mangan *lecturer in machine learning & roboticssheffield robotics & dept of computer scienceuniversity of sheffield* https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.sheffield.ac.uk_dcs_people_academic_mmangan&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=pw0k0hke3-iu-um8yjsqk8ccqfoxjuu4pese4fewzjy&s=jdfvostsjxpogn_-y3klruan8_enru76mdunuteetpa&e=

subject: senior computer vision engineer/ lead  computer vision engineer- dorabot inc.
content: dorabot is expanding and hiring for new positions! join us in revolutionizing  robotics by applying cutting-edge technology to real world scenarios.  *senior computer vision engineer/ lead computer vision engineer*  1. work with both 2d (rgb) and 3d (depth) raw perception data. 2. solve vision tasks including but not limited to the following: - vision sensor calibration (internal and external) - identifying and classifying objects, generating bounding boxes, segmenting objects, and generating object masks - measuring object sizes - estimating and tracking object poses - learning/scanning new objects quickly with surface reconstruction - identifying and reading barcodes - large-scale automatic data collection - efficient and autonomous data labeling - vision-based mapping, localization, and navigation 3. program robots to perform the tasks listed above in various lighting conditions, with heavy occlusion, while robots/cameras are moving at high speeds. 4. the job might involve researching particular topics, reading papers, attending conferences, efficiently implementing algorithms for hardware, testing, debugging, parallelization, sourcing sensors and computing platforms, writing documents/papers, and generating patents. position requirements	 1. background in computer vision, computer graphics, image processing, machine learning or other related fields, phd is preferred 2. very skilled in c++ and python (knowledge and daily experience) 3. solid knowledge of computer vision with experience of turning theories into practical programs. 4. very skilled with vision libraries: opencv, pcl, etc. 5. very skilled with deep learning frameworks: tensor flow, keras, etc. 6. skilled with machine learning techniques, especially deep learning, reinforcement learning, and transfer learning. preferred qualifications	 1. published author in computer vision and graphics journals and attended conferences such as cvpr, iccv, siggraph, etc. 2. experienced in programming, robotics, or vision algorithm challenges, e.g. ilsvrc 3. strong experience in any of the following areas: - image detection and segmentation - scene comprehension - image captioning - video analysis - multi-object pose estimation - rgb-d segmentation - 3d reconstruction - motion tracking - large-scale datasets creation - multi-cluster gpu training - open source project collaboration - blogging/writing about computer vision or robotics here?s a bit about our company:  dorabot is an ai and robotics company developing loading, sorting,  induction, and  transportation solutions for market-leading logistics companies in the us  and china. headquartered in shenzhen and backed by some of china's most  prominent tech magnates, we're a tight-knit team of visionaries that live  and breathe robotics.  as e-commerce has exploded, order fulfillment still largely depends on  traditional  resources. dorabot's advanced solutions allow express couriers to automate,  keep up with increasing demand, and fully embrace the future.  unique among early-stage chinese startups, dorabot employs people from over  10  different countries and views diversity as a key to their success. among  dorabot?s  employees are former ups executives and amazon robotics challenge champions  from germany and australia.  dorabot is currently piloting sorting solutions in the us, which will be  rolled out to  additional facilities in 2019, followed by our loading and transportation  systems.  our website: www.dorabot.com  what we offer:  -a competitive salary and company equity based on experience and personal  contributions  -an amazing opportunity to experience life in shenzhen, widely known as  china?s silicon valley. shenzhen has the best air quality of any major city  in china!  -free chinese lessons  -free lunches and fresh fruit  -an international workplace where english is our working language  -on-site company gym  -plenty of resources to purchase all kinds of equipment for research and  development  *dorabot videos:*  dorabot solution compilation video - https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__youtu.be_3-2dr9gbgq-2dds&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kgrhwodzsadebg_kjfkvzm0ph6tuzffhnjj6b0d6v9a&s=x1fxg1pf-nscyxcv5drv7ffyhza6uhtpxlzp7iitv_g&e= a short video we put together showcasing our various solutions and  technologies for dhl?s robotics day event in germany.  dorabot rewind 2018: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_watch-3fv-3dzop88u-2dnrlk&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kgrhwodzsadebg_kjfkvzm0ph6tuzffhnjj6b0d6v9a&s=l9nev45wmqclayxab0gwqsu3x_6ktowocav2awbqjae&e= -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=m66anz4mku4chnz1-abwjuqwgfqqftcjmyjoxd7qvf4&s=liwum7pvrxgpump-sdagrr-jsyjkpedpzmikg9nok0g&e=

subject: phd positions in robotics and related  areas at monash university, australia
content: ====================================================================== ph.d. position in robotics and related areas faculty of engineering monash university clayton, melbourne, australia ====================================================================== overview: we are pleased to announce phd positions in robotics and related areas at monash university including:    -    hri/hci    -    robotics vision    -    assistive robotics    -    social robotics    -    augmented reality    -    medical/surgical robotics    -    agricultural robotics    -    construction robotics    -    multi-robot systems    -    connected, self-driving vehicles    -    real time sensing and hardware acceleration    -    autonomous unmanned aerial systems    -    deep learning for robotics as a phd student at monash, you will have the opportunity to work with world-leading researchers at the university ranked number one* in australia for engineering and technology and among the top 100 universities in the world. we offer a range of scholarships for australian and international graduate research students, including tuition fees, stipends and relocation allowances. scholarships are awarded based on academic merit. applications for our graduate research degrees are accepted all year, but those who wish to apply for monash?s scholarships <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.monash.edu_graduate-2dresearch_future-2dstudents_scholarships&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tjcffes0th_7v7uchfgaqftfg4skz3tycrfghc3ux3e&s=p5yisgz-wwadrbqe3oqcr_tq0ucazb7c83veiofar3q&e= > should apply by the following dates: 31 march - for international students with admission between july-december 31 may - for domestic students with admission between july-december 31 august - for international students with admission between january-june 31 october - for domestic students with admission between january-june successful candidates will be supervised by one of our engineering faculty members including:    -    prof. elizabeth croft    -    prof. dana kulic    -    prof. sunita chauhan    -    dr elahe abdi    -    prof. hai vu    -    dr mehrdad arashpour    -    assoc prof. lindsay kleeman    -    dr yihai fang    -    dr hoam chung    -    dr chao chen    -    prof tom drummond monash university offers world-class robotics research, testing, and training equipment and facility, including the monash immersive visualisation platform (mivp) <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.monash.edu_researchinfrastructure_mivp&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tjcffes0th_7v7uchfgaqftfg4skz3tycrfghc3ux3e&s=f3sjr2khxql7plnt_revowqqot2hdv_u_sutbjj0m0k&e= >. monash university is expanding our investment in robotics and ai through a new centre for robotics research, new buildings and facilities devoted to technology, education and entrepreneurship and the recently announced monash data futures institute. melbourne is one of the most vibrant and multicultural cities in the world. it has been ranked as the world?s number one most liveable city by the economist intelligence unit for six consecutive years. as the capital of victoria state, melbourne houses an exciting mix of sport, culture, nature, culinary, and style. entry requirements:    -    a four year bachelor?s degree in a relevant field, which includes a    significant research component or an honours year, leading to an honours 1    or equivalent; or    -    a master?s degree in a relevant field that includes a significant    research component (at least 25% of one full time equivalent year of work),    including a thesis with a minimum of h1a or equivalent you will also need to meet minimum english language requirements. how to apply: upon checking their eligibility, prospective students should find a potential supervisor(s) and submit an ?expression of interest? form to robotics at monash.edu, indicating which supervisor(s) they would like to work with in the email. applicants may be required to attend a skype/zoom interview before receiving an ?invitation to apply?. after receiving an ?invitation to apply?, the prospective student can then lodge an application for admission and scholarship online. see more information on how to apply at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.monash.edu_engineering_future-2dstudents_graduate-2dresearch_how-2dto-2dapply&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tjcffes0th_7v7uchfgaqftfg4skz3tycrfghc3ux3e&s=f9skccjh_xdabyt9xw-ofkv9xe5o6zlqp1qdq7kp05o&e=  *times higher education, world university ranking, 2018 on behalf of the faulty of engineering, monash university, wesley chan research fellow electrical and computer systems engineering monash university australia

subject: multiple fully-funded phd positions in  the deep learning for robotics at csiro and qut, brisbane, australia
content: [jobs] multiple fully-funded phd positions in the deep learning for robotics at csiro and qut, brisbane, australia application deadline: aug 30, 2019, australian time do you want to work for two of the world's leading research organisations, live in a city with extremely high standard of living, enjoy pristine beaches and sun all year round, and still carry out ground breaking deep learning, robotics research to solve real-world challenges? if so, this position is for you. multiple fully funded phd positions are available as a part of a research collaboration between the robotics and autonomous systems group at the commonwealth scientific and industrial organization (csiro) and the queensland university of technology (qut), in brisbane, australia. you will receive a scholarship of $28,000 per year (+$10,000 top-up, +$5000 conference fund) for 3.5 years all tax free! they are ongoing positions to be filled at any time before the deadline. 1. self-supervised learning for robotics more information and how to apply: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__research.csiro.au_robotics_self-2dsupervised-2dlearning_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dkudhwaaetemttdflolnzf5jjueakxbquwcn3xchcuc&s=iooy8o8lqtscvoxradqou1xz_vhrnntkzmlonfivqlw&e=  2. deep slam more information and how to apply: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__research.csiro.au_robotics_deep-2dslam-2dphd_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dkudhwaaetemttdflolnzf5jjueakxbquwcn3xchcuc&s=e3wz3lyqo5huld5njjh43dczuj2hfetojbeyfi4qls8&e=  3. hyperspectral deep learning more information and how to apply: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__research.csiro.au_robotics_hyperspectral-2ddeep-2dlearning_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dkudhwaaetemttdflolnzf5jjueakxbquwcn3xchcuc&s=cnx-vafktrwxebwb-ivix0unyuwjsf1wuhknrcsfebo&e=  bests, a/prof. peyman moghadam csiro

subject: postdoctoral researchers in multi-agent  optimisation/scheduling and equipment automation for mining at the  university of sydney, australia
content: we are looking for some postdocs to join the rio tinto centre for mine automation, a group within the australian centre for field robotics<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__sydney.edu.au_engineering_our-2dresearch_robotics-2dand-2dintelligent-2dsystems_australian-2dcentre-2dfor-2dfield-2drobotics.html&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nynfcktcfcrz_dcorhuziiupv6tvd0mkgvnwojdl2tm&s=nhlt6iweb0nfmymyo4vioix7xs57mtlm3ub_kbx67k0&e= > at the university of sydney (australia). the position is research only, fixed-term with current funding to 2021. the rtcma is an industry-funded centre with a long (12-year) history working with rio tinto to deploy state-of-the-art research algorithms into production systems. we have a team of academics as well as software developers working together to not only perform the academic research, but turn these ideas into practical systems. positions below, see links for full details: optimisation of multi-agent fleets of autonomous mining vehicles   *   level a/b postdoc positions   *   the ideal candidate should have experience in optimisation, control, operations research, multi-agent scheduling or planning, and the programming skills to develop and test algorithms in these areas.   *   https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__sydney.nga.net.au_cp_index.cfm-3fevent-3djobs.checkjobdetailsnewapplication-26jobid-3d51e3941f-2d5754-2d479b-2d8700-2daa8000c6d440&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nynfcktcfcrz_dcorhuziiupv6tvd0mkgvnwojdl2tm&s=8himhw8r0x_rrgjagbnmfw-7-9tkyoolsrsmdhbgvig&e=    *   applications close 11th august heavy equipment automation   *   level c position to lead a research project within the centre   *   the ideal candidate should have experience in perception and sensing for field robotics, task and motion planning, and the programming skills to develop and test algorithms in these areas including planning/controlling interactions between vehicles cooperating to perform tasks, as well as experience managing a research project and/or supervising in a research project context.   * subject: computer vision engineer: object pose  estimation. dorabot.
content: we aim to gather the smartest robot enthusiasts to build a fully autonomous robot that can see and operate in the human environment, bring a true robotic future to life. for this position, we are looking for a talented software engineer with a deep background in vision and robot perception. *job description* 1. work with both 2d (rgb) and 3d (depth) raw perception data, sometimes even with other sensors who provides other modalities of percepts of the world. 2. solving vision tasks include but not limited to: ? vision sensor calibration (internal and external) ? identify and classify objects, generate bounding boxes, segment objects/ generate object masks ? measure object size in physical unit ? estimate and tracking object pose ? learn/ scan new objects in short time, possibly with surface reconstruction ? identify and read barcodes ? large-scale automatic data collection ? efficient (even autonomous) data labeling ? vision-based mapping, localization, and navigation 3. perform these tasks (if applicable) efficiently and robustly, against various lighting conditions/ under heavy occlusion/ while the relative pose between camera and object are changing as high speed/ multiple objects at the same time/ multiple cameras at the same time/ across different sensors/ deploy them on real robot hardware etc. 4. work on challenging scenarios such as the partially observable, sequential, dynamic, continuous, and unstructured environment. 5. the job might involve researching on a particular topic, reading papers, attending conferences, efficiently implementing algorithms on hardware, testing in the real environment, debugging, parallelization, sourcing sensors, and computing platforms, writing documents/ papers, generating patents, and other possible forms. * position requirement* 1. background in computer vision, computer graphics, image processing, machine learning or other related fields 2. proficient with c++ and python (knowledge and daily experience) 3. solid knowledge of computer vision theory with past experience of turning those theories into a robust program. 4. proficient with vision library: opencv, pcl, etc. 5. proficient in deep learning frameworks: tensor flow, keras, etc. 6. skilled with machine learning techniques, especially deep learning, reinforcement learning and transfer learning. *who we are* dorabot is an ai and robotics company developing loading, sorting, induction, and transportation solutions for market-leading logistics companies in the us and asia. headquartered in shenzhen and backed by some of the most prominent tech magnates, we're a tight-knit team of visionaries that live and breathe robotics. as e-commerce has exploded, order fulfillment still largely depends on traditional resources. dorabot's advanced solutions allow express couriers to automate, keep up with increasing demand, and fully embrace the future. unique among early-stage asian startups, dorabot employs people from over 10 different countries and views diversity as a key to their success. among dorabot?s employees are former ups executives and amazon robotics challenge champions from germany and australia. dorabot is currently piloting sorting solutions in the us, which will be rolled out to additional facilities in 2019, followed by our loading and transportation systems. our website: *www.dorabot.com <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.dorabot.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ytuu718g3oehz-qldhofcxqnjqzpgc0ypuzqpojuzto&s=drpxgg83pmpqvjq29g_4l2-jbr7a0-cpx4oihf5mftm&e= >* dorabot solution compilation video - *https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__youtu.be_3-2dr9gbgq-2dds&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ytuu718g3oehz-qldhofcxqnjqzpgc0ypuzqpojuzto&s=-p2d1s630lgs6b13zr8evak8lcs72vu_duk-rs3hdhm&e=
